loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Jovia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells goods like sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Jovia has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business, and will help Jovia to generate greater profits. Jovia hopes that in the future she will be able to become rich. 

Jovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: expand the business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 28 year old married lady and the mother of two children, aged five and three years. She operates a green grocery in the Narok area.  She has run the business for the last one year, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.


She has borrowed her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to purchase more stock for the business. 


The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children.  Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gerardo Eliecer

texts.es:
Genaro Eliecer tiene 51 años de edad es casado tiene 11 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Genaro Eliecer se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, papas, mora y además se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos, aves.

Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en San Pablo. El sueño es comprar más ganado y aumentar las crías.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte, ver televisión, salir a pasear, y disfrutar de las festividades del Patrono Arcángel.
texts.en:
Genaro Eliecer is 51 years old, married, and has 11 children. He lives with his wife and children in San Miguel, which is in Bolívar Province.

Genaro is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Miguel”, which is located in the community of Paila Loma in the canton of San Miguel. This community is 40 minutes away from the Chillanes branch office of Cooperativa San José. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Genaro Eliecer is a farmer who grows corn, beans, potatoes, and blackberries. He also raises cattle, pigs, and poultry. He is requesting a loan to buy livestock. With the help of this loan, he will be able to make this purchase. His dream is to buy more livestock and increase his herd.

In his free time Genaro enjoys practicing sports, watching television, going for walks, and enjoying the festivals of the patron archangel.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her hardware store, where she sells different types of cement, paint, etc. 

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her business' size, and will help Flavia to generate greater profits by having a larger stock of capital. Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business and be self reliant. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Flavia, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase the size of her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 27 years old, single and the mother of one child. She runs a clothing store in Narok area, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to buy more clothes for resale. She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and diversify her business. 

Her future plan is for her business to become a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale, and to pay for transport costs from the warehouse.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old.He is married to Mary who is a businesswoman. Joseph repairs cameras and has been in this business for the past 18 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 25,000 from his business.

This is his first loan from  KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase tools to improve the repair of the cameras and also to purchase spare parts for the cameras.

He hopes to own a permanent place where he can do his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his job.

loans.name: Munhkbayar

texts.en:
Munkhbayar, 42, sells fruits in the bazaar and she has been doing her business for 9 years. She lives with her husband and her son in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family owns a house which is built from wood, but it has air leaks through the walls and corners. That is the main reason why it costs too much for coal and other fuels, so she wants to repair her house walls by adding insulation. She needs some building materials such as bricks, cement, rock wool and other insulation materials. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of the main reasons for Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buy the building and insulation materials for her house wall insulation.

loans.use: To buy the building and insulation materials for her house wall insulation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Mary has been working hard to manage her hospitality business, where she sells alcohol and accommodation. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business and will help Mary generate greater profits and increase her profit margin. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to establish many businesses in Uganda. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: expand her business.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is single and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Dennis has been working hard to manage his electronics store, where he sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Dennis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his working capital, and will help Dennis to generate greater profits so he can then expand his business. Dennis hopes that in the future, he will be able to grow his business. 

Dennis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dennis, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to sell phone accessories.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Anna has been working hard to manage her grocery, where she sells food stuffs and produce. 

To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her capital stock, and will help Anna to generate greater profits and to expand the size of her business. Anna hopes that in the future, she will be able to be self-reliant. 

Anna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anna, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand the size of her grocery store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old and married, with three children who are all in school.

Peter is a farmer and has been in this business for the past six years. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD, to enable him to buy some fertilizers and seedlings to use in his farm.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауф трудолюбивый и добрый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Жена занимается домохозяйством и как только заканчивает  домашние дела она помогает мужу. Абдурауф занимается выращиванием лука, дыни, гороха и огурцов. Его земля составляет 4, 60 гектаров. Абдурауф хочет поднять урожайность своей земли и для этого ему необходимо обрабатывать свою землю и с этой целью запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений. Абдурауф надеется на вашу помощь, и заранее благодарен вам за вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Abdurauf is a hard-working and kind man, he is married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker and, as soon as she is finished her her chores around the house, helps her husband. Abdurauf grows onions, melons, peas, and cucumbers. He owns 4.6 hectares of land. Abdurauf wants to increase the yield of his land, thus he needs to cultivate his land and that is the reason he is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.  Abdurauf is hoping for your help and in advance is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rut

texts.es:
La señora Rut es socia del banco comunal “El Paraíso” del Distrito de Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos menores.
Recién lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando  con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de plantas ornamentales de todos los tamaños.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1000,00 nuevos soles comprará: 50 baldes de plástico en  diferentes tamaños, 25 costales,  1 tijera de podar, 1 botella de veneno para insectos.
Disfruta su trabajo porque está rodeada de pura naturaleza, por las tardes es cuando tiene que atender a sus plantas para ordenarlas según el tamaño o cambiarles de embases a medida que van creciendo, agradece a Manuela Ramos por apostar por las mujeres que desean trabajar y así poder generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Rut is a member of of El Paraiso (The Paradise), a Communal Bank located in the Coronel Portillo district, in the De Ucayali department. She is 39 years old, she is married and she has three young children.
She has already worked four cycles with Manuela Ramos and she sells ornamental plants of every size.
With her new loan of 1,000 PEN she will buy 50 plastic buckets of different sizes, 25 sacks, 1 secateurs and 1 bottle of insecticide.
She likes her job because she is surrounded by the purity of nature; the evenings is when she cares for her plants, ordering them according to size or changing their vases as they grow. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for betting on those women wanting to work to earn their own money.

loans.use: To buy plastic buckets, sacks, secateurs and insecticide.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 27 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Margaret has been working hard to manage her bridal wear shop, where she makes bridal gowns and dresses brides. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand the business, and will help Margaret to generate greater profits and to increase her capital. Margaret hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a bigger shop. 

Margaret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margaret, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand the business.

loans.name: Muyasara

texts.ru: Муяссара  очень добрая и отзывчивая  женщина. Она мать двоих детей и примерная жена. Учительницей она работает уже четыре года. Так как зарплата простого учителя на сегодняшний день не так уж велика, она занимается  также куплей продажей  сухофруктов. Она обычно покупает товары  оптом  от оптовиков, обрабатывает их  и сдает своим постоянным клиентам. Цель её займа в том чтобы приобрести 80 шт. абрикосового деревья. Выращивать их, обсушивать его плоды вместе с детьми. Так как она знает только в этом деле она  знает, что в осенние и зимние время  они возрастут в  цене и могут дать не плохую прибыль.
texts.en:
Muyasara is a very kind and compassionate woman. She is a mother of two children and a loving wife. Muyasara has been working as a teacher for the past four years. However, as a teacher's salary today is quite low, she also buys and resells dried fruit. Usually, she purchases fruit in bulk from wholesalers, processes it, and then sells it to her regular customers.

The purpose of Muyasara's loan is to buy 80 apricot trees. She will cultivate them and, together with her children, dry their fruit. Being quite experienced in this business, Muyasara knows that the price of dried apricots will go up in the autumn and winter, and they can bring a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase apricot trees for production of dried apricots

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 34 years old, married and supports a family of three. He is an artisan and has made steel and metal items, namely, doors and windows, for the past 12 years. He earns a monthly income of KES. 80,000. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET and he plans to purchase materials to assemble more steel items and structures. 

The anticipated profits will help open expand to open another shop. His future dreams is to buy a piece of land for his family

loans.use: to purchase steel bars and other materials to make steel items and structures.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда долгие годы занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов. Она торгует  в разных местах. Её сухофрукты пользуются хорошим спросом у покупателей.  Её муж иммигрирует  чтобы прокормить  свою семью ну и Махсуда тоже трудится в поту лица. Годовой доход позволил ей  провести мероприятия в честь (хатнатуй) своих детей. Также она занимается обсушкой абрикоса своего собственного сада. Недавно её сын перенёс  тяжелейшую  операцию, большая часть дохода ушло на его лечение. В жизни Махсуды было много падений, но она преодолевала их с достоинством. Сейчас она просит, подержат её с расширении её бизнеса и надеется  на вас.
texts.en: For many years, Mahsuda has been processing and selling dried fruit, some of which comes from her own orchard. She sells her product in different locations and it is always in high demand. Mahsuda's husband is moving away from home to earn money for his family, and she is also working hard to do her part. Last year's profits allowed Mahsuda to hold traditional circumcision ceremonies for her children. Her son recently underwent major surgery, and a large part of the profits was used to cover his medical expenses. Mahsuda's life has brought her many trials, but she overcame them and kept her poise. Right now, she is asking for your support as she expands her business and hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase apricots for drying and resale

loans.name: Blanca Dorila

texts.es:
Blanca Dorila tiene 71 años de edad es casada tiene 1 hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en  en san Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC PATRON SAN MIGUEL se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Paila Loma Cantón San Miguel, a una distancia de 40 minutos a la oficina de la Cooperativa San José Agencia Chillanes, los socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Blanca Dorila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz , fréjol, papas, mora además se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos, gallinas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea y una ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la semilla y el ganado.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima. El sueño es poder tener salud comprar terreno.

Los desafíos a los que se nefrenta es la pérdida de la cosecha. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, estar con la familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Dorila is 71 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her husband and son in San Miguel, which is in Bolívar Province.

Blanca is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Miguel”, which is located in the community of Paila Loma in the canton of San Miguel. This community is 40 minutes away from the Chillanes branch office of Cooperativa San José. The members of this Communal Bank engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Blanca is a farmer who grows corn, beans, potatoes, and blackberries. She also raises cattle, pigs, and chickens. Blanca is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, urea, and a head of cattle. With the help of this loan, she will be able to make these purchases. The challenges she faces include dealing with bad weather and crop losses. She dreams of having good health and buying a plot of land.

In her free time, Blanca enjoys watching television and spending time with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, and a head of cattle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 23 years old. He supplies soft drinks to retail shops to earn a living. He has been operating this business for two years. Previously, he used to run a motorcycle transport business. He has learned to save with the training he received from Faulu Kenya in financial management. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 46 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 18 years, John has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells clothing. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to fill his capital gap,  which will help John to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. John hopes that in the future he will be able to expand into a larger business. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his clothing shop.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 27 years old. She is married to Muhia, and together they have two children who are both going to school. Miriam is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is her third loan  from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow, which will help increase milk production.

Miriam hopes to purchase a plot of land where her family can build a home.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 29 years old, married and blessed with five children that he supports. He practices mixed farming, and he has been involved in this farming activity for the past five years, with a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

He is applying for his second loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase livestock and prepare his garden for growing crops.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. His future dream is to have a stable business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and prepare his garden for growing crops.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 31 years old and has just come back from Greece after working there for several years. He and his family live in the northeast of Albania and were isolated from the blood feud until very recently, just like so many other families in this part of the country. Despite the authorities’ interventions, those families haven’t received any significant support. People are scared to venture outdoors in case they're killed − all because of decades' old 'blood feuds'. In most of the cases, a fortified tower is used as a refuge for men involved in a blood feud who are vulnerable to attack.

Nevertheless, Augustin’s family has been in the livestock business for the past eight years and the business has been going well. Now, he plans to grow the business and get the family members all involved in it, and for this Augustin is requesting a Kiva loan through VisionFund Albania. With any profits, he will be able to save for his family and his future also. 

He realizes, though, that he cannot do any of these without Kiva lenders’ understanding and support and he very much thanks all of them in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 49 years old. He is married to Monicah and together they have two children. Willy sells timber besides being a general transporter. He gets a monthly income of KES 45,000 from the business.

This is his his first loan. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase a power saw to use in his timber business.

He hopes to start a workshop for furniture making in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a power saw.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan used her previous loan amount to buy more quarry tools and equipment. This enabled her to increase her production and income and she was able to pay off the loan well and in good time.

This being her second loan, she plans to buy a big blocks of stones and extract small sizes of building blocks from them. This will enable her to increase her stock and also meet the demands of her customers. With the anticipated income, she plans to buy a motorcycle for her husband.

In the future, Susan hopes to grow her business and supply building blocks to different construction sites in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy blocks of stones for making building blocks.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his small business performing carpentry services. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to invest in the business, which will help Patrick to generate greater profits and to expand his business. Patrick hopes that in the future, he will be able to meet all his customers' expectations. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 27 years old and married to Gilbert. They live in Nakuru town and have one child. Frida has been selling molasses in bulk and it has been profitable.

This will be her second loan and she plans to buy more stock of molasses for resale and thereby meet the demands of her customers as well as make more income.

In the future, she would like to invest in other businesses, like clothing sales, make more income and buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of molasses for resale.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
Guldasta is a person with a wonderful nature. She likes flowers, trees, plants and all things which are connected with garden and field. She works in the National Park. Guldasta likes her work very much. As she loves her job, she works heartily and with pleasure. Guldasta grows different kinds of flowers in the National Park. She has two clever children and brings up them alone because she is a widow. 

As her house is in bad condition, she wants to repair it. She wants to take a loan for buying building materials. It would be fortunate if you helped a wonderful woman by the name of Guldasta.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing the house.

loans.name: Blanca Idalia

texts.es:
Blanca, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder atender mejor a su clientela, comprándose maíz, leña, gas, gaseosas jugos y refrescos, esto le ayudará a ofrecerle una mayor variedad a sus clientes, dando la oportunidad de mantener su preferencia.

Con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse lo necesario para tener un negocio con más capacidad, para atender a los clientes, esto le ha traído buenos beneficios económicos ya que ha incrementado sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan so that she can provide better service to her customers. She will buy corn, firewood, gas, sodas, juices, and soft drinks. This will help her offer a wider variety of products to her customers and provide her with the opportunity to maintain the loyalty of her clientele.

With her previous loan, Blanca was able to buy what she needed to help her business gain more capacity for serving her customers. This resulted in good financial benefits and an increase in her earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas, sodas, juices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old and a single mother of three children, ages 12, seven and two years old. She runs a retail shop, with good income.

This will be her first loan amount and she plans to buy more stock of rice, maize flour, cooking oil and washing detergents for resale. This will enable her to satisfy her customers' demands and also to earn more income, with which she plans to improve the living standards of her family.

In the future, Rose would like to grow her business and open more retail shops in other places of Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dhurata

texts.en:
Dhurata is a 28-year-old Egyptian woman from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic communities of Albania. She is married and has three children ranging in age from 4 to 11 years old, with two of them attending public school. Just like so many others of her ethnicity, she and her husband work in very hard labor jobs trying to support their children and do all this without seeking any governmental assistance. All of them live in a one-room house in very poor conditions and an unhealthy environment, with no water and no toilet. The ceiling is literally sagging down as if it is about to fall down any minute, endangering their lives.
 
Dhurata is seeking a loan for the first time to purchase building materials to somehow improve her family's living conditions. She needs to do this now when the weather permits. Dhurata’s family is all grateful to the VFA and Kiva for the opportunity they have been granted because they believe this loan will save their lives.

loans.use: to buy materials to rebuild the ceiling that is sagging down.

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en:
Batsukh, 57, is a skilled blacksmith and craftsman. He makes traditional souvenirs, fret works, small statues and other national crafts. His skill is derived from his father and he was one of the most skilled craftsmen in Mongolia. For 20 years, he has been doing his business and he has gained enough experience and dexterity. He was divorced many years ago, and now lives alone in the ger district (ger is a Mongolian nomadic traditional yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All of his children have already moved out the home. But one of his sons took over his craft skills and he wants to transfer his business to his son. 

Now he needs to renovate some of his craft tools and equipment due to age and wear of all of them. He is planning to replace his coal firing stove with an electric stove, which costs very little to use and is harmless to the environment. He uses it to burn and produce raw materials for making his crafts. A stove costs a lot in the Mongolian market. Batsukh thinks it will stop the extremely harmful coal usage if he purchases an electric stove for his business. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of his purchasing an electric stove for his crafts business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of his purchasing an electric stove for his crafts business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 39 years old. He is married to Virginia and together they have one child. John sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for the past ten years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to us by one our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase second hand clothes for resale.

He hopes to educate his child to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Escilda

texts.es: Escilda de 58 años de edad, tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, que inició desde el año 2008, con el propósito de responder a la  necesidad de sostenimiento y bienestar de su hogar.  Poco a poco su negocio ha crecido, pues ella ha hecho vínculos con empresas que venden productos, ofreciéndoles a sus distribuidores como Escilda,  guías especializadas o catálogos a través de las cuales promocionar diversos artículos, tal como ella lo hace; Escilda ha logrado acceder a 4 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que es su fuente principal de financiación de capital de trabajo, con esto créditos ha logrado adquirir su casa propia en el programa sueños y oportunidades, que lidera esta misma organización y aumentar las posibilidades de capitalizar su negocio.  En esta misma casa, ella espera ubicar mas adelante una miscelánea con los productos de mayor rotación en esta comunidad, con un alto potencial de desarrollo y en la que ella muy seguramente cumplirá su sueño de posicionamiento en punto fijo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará artículos cosméticos, perfumería que vinieron en sus catálogos con precios especiales, y también comprará ropa para damas, para distribuirla por encargo y para ir abordando poco a poco este nuevo espacio comercial futuro.
texts.en: Escilda is 58 years old, and in 2008 she started selling different kinds of products in order to provide for the support and wellbeing necessities of her family. Her activity has grown little by little as she has made agreements with some companies that sell their products by giving specialized products guides or catalogues to retailers like Escilda, who then promote their different items. Escilda has succeeded in obtaining 4 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, her main working capital provider. Thanks to these loans she has succeeded in buying her own home through the 'Sueños y Opportunidades' (Dreams and Opportunities) program run by the same Fundación, as well as in increasing the chances to capitalize her activity. In the future she hopes to sell from her house the products mostly requested in her community, which has a great development rate and where she will surely succeed in positioned her activity in a fixed place. She is currently asking for a loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes sold in her catalogues at a special price; she will also buy  women's clothes to distribute them by request, in order to enter little by little in this new commercial activity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes and women's clothes.

loans.name: Idalia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Idalia de 45 años de edad, habitante de Granada es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta  a su cargo, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, es dueña de un pequeño tramo en la ciudad de Granada. Inicio su negocio desde hace 22 años  con apoyo de su esposo quien la motivo para que dejara de andar vendiendo de manera ambulante y tuviera más tiempo para estar con sus hijos, después el esposo fallece y queda a cargo del negocio ella, el cual ha sacado adelante con el apoyo de su hija mayor quien la ayuda a atender a los clientes. Idalia cuenta con otros ingresos pues también trabaja de domestica en un hospedaje de la ciudad de Granada,  hoy en día Idalia quiere diversificarse mas en productos para su negocio  por esa razón  solicita el crédito para comprar ropa interior, tintes para el pelo, camisas, pantalones y cosméticos  con el objetivo de surtir su inventario, ella estima el crédito será de ayuda pues podrá invertir en su negocio en productos mas solicitados por sus clientes, incrementaran sus ventas, mejorando a la vez sus ingresos, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su tramo para que sea mas seguro y poder guardar su mercadería para evitar el gasto de pagar alquiler de bodega, sus metas próximas es seguir trabajando en el negocio para tener mejores condiciones de vida y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Idalia is 45 years old, she lives in Granada and she has 4 children, and only the youngest of them is economically dependent in her. She is a retailer selling underwear. She owns a small vending station in Granada. She started her activity 22 years ago thanks to her husband’ support: he encouraged her to stop being a street vendor and to spend more time with her children. When her husband died, she became responsible for the activity, and she has made it progress with the support of her eldest daughter who helps her tending to customers. Idalia can count on other earnings because she works as a housekeeper in a hotel of Granada. Idalia now wants to offer different products in her shop, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy underwear, hair dyes, shirts, trousers and cosmetics, in order to stock-up her inventory. She thinks the loans will help her because she will be able to invest it in her activity by purchasing the products her customs request the most; her sales will consequently increase, thus improving her earnings. In the future she plans on improving the infrastructure of her vending station so that it will be safer and in order to keep her products there avoiding to pay rent for a store. Her future goal is to keep on working in her shop to reach a better standard of living and to progress together with her family.

loans.use: To buy underwear, hair dyes, shirts, trousers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que continúa en la venta de pollo dorado y necesita invertir en el negocio, se comprará pollo ya lavado aceite, condimentos, y otros ingredientes que necesita para lograr el pollo y mantener su buen sabor, esto le ayudará a darle continuidad al negocio y a mantenerse fiel con sus bien.

El credito anterior le ayudó para generarle una mejor rentabilidad, ya que ha logrado tener la producción de pollo dorado a sus clientes, sus condiciones económicas a través de los préstamos están superando.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan, since she is continuing to sell fried chicken and needs to invest in her business.  She will buy dressed chicken, oil, condiments, and other ingredients that she needs to make her chicken and maintain its great flavor.  This will help her to give continuity to her business and maintain fidelity to her good product.

Her former loan helped her to create greater profitability, now that she has had success in producing fried chicken for her customers, and her economic status is getting better thanks to the loans.

loans.use: to buy chicken pieces, oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 35 years old. He is married to Veronica and together they have two children. 

He operates a boutique and has been in the business for the past four years. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase more clothes and shoes for stock in his business.

He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for stock in his business.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Don Pedro Inicio con su negocio de venta de ropa hace dos años, pues antes era trabajador de una fabrica pero renuncio para emprender su propio negocio y buscar mejores ingresos. Aunque el es originario del Sauce, León habita en la ciudad de Granada pues al casarse tuvo que mudarse de ciudad, el es padre de un hijo, el cual es independiente. Su esposa lo ayuda con el negocio de la ropa mientras ella escoge los estilos y colores para vender el se dedica a negociar los precios y las rutas de ventas, este negocio es familiar ya que juntos buscan como salir adelante para progresar. El necesita el crédito para comprar más inventario de ropa tales como camisas para damas , caballeros, faldas, jeans, camisetas sport de diferentes estilos y colores. El además de trabajar en su negocio cuando la temporada esta baja el se dedica a vender y colectar pagos por la venta de lavanderos para de esta forma conseguir ingresos. El se va a vender a las isletas cercanas y comarcas de Granada.  Su proyecto de vida es ampliar su negocio vendiendo no solo ropa sino también productos que su misma clientela le demande.
texts.en: Pedro started his clothes selling activity two years ago: he used to work in a factory but he decided to quit to start his own activity and earn a better income. Although being a native of Sauce, León, he lives in the town of Granada, where he had to move when he got married. He has one son who is economically independent. His wife helps him with the clothes selling activity: she chooses the styles and colors of the clothes to sell, while he negotiates prices and selling routes. This is a family-run activity as they work together to find ways to get ahead and to progress. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes such as shirts for women and for men, skirts, jeans and T-shirts of different styles and colors. On top of engaging in his activity, during the low season he engages in selling washtubs and cashing the relevant payments, in order to earn some more money. He sells in the small islands and in the neighboring areas of Granada. His life project is to expand his activity selling not only clothes but also other products that his customer may request.

loans.use: To buy  shirts for women and for men, skirts, jeans and T-shirts of different styles and colors.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Mrs. Tungalag, 44, is a hairdresser. She rents the workshop that she has been using for eight years nonstop. She is widowed and lives with her two daughters and her son in her old and bad house, which is in the ger (Mongolian housing tents) district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For many years her house has been old and uncomfortable to live in. Also, it has an emission through the walls and corners. She wants to repair her house walls by making insulation. She needs some building materials such as bricks, cement, rock wool and other insulation materials. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters when temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in the summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of the main reasons for Mongolian air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers green loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy the cars that run on natural gas. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan she is taking will used to buy building and insulation materials for her house wall insulation.

loans.use: To buy building and insulation materials for her house wall insulation.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olivia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere darle mantenimiento a la venta de ropa y también a la venta de pescado, pues ella manifiesta que los préstamos de ayuda para poder mantenerse competente en el negocio y comprarse la mercadería necesaria por ejemplo camisas, ropa interior y en el área de de mariscos, pescado, camarones, entre otros especies.

Ella ha incrementado el negocio y la clientela todo a través del crecimiento que le dio el crédito anterior, con ello ha logrado generar una mayor solvencia económica familia.
texts.en:
Olivia is asking for a new loan, since she wants to maintain her clothing business and also her fish sales business.  She says that the loans are a help to be able to keep her business in good shape and to buy the necessary merchandise, for example, shirts, underwear, and in the seafood genre, fishes, shrimp, and other species.

She has increased her business and her customer base through the growth that happened thanks to the prior credit, with which she has been able to achieve greater economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, underwear, and also fish and shrimp.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and married with one child who is 13 years old and in school.

George has a business of selling bed covers and curtains; he has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to buy more stock of bed covers and curtains.

He hopes to expand his business and make more profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bed covers and curtains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy decals, pedals, seats and spokes.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a hardworking and goal-oriented woman. She is single and the loving mother of one who is still underage. She is a good woman and always cares about the well-being of her home. She lives in a rental house with her child.

For more than five years, she has been reselling clothes in a boutique. Mwanahawa says that she depends on this business for her livelihood. She mainly buys the merchandise at the central market in the city of Mombasa. 

At this time, Mwanahawa wants to buy a new assortment of children's and women's clothing to restock her boutique. With this purpose, she is asking for a loan amounting to 20,000 Kenyan shillings. She hopes to expand her business and open another boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of children's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Leonor Isabel

texts.es:
Leonor, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de volver a invertir en productos enchapados y cosméticos que son necesarios para mantener fiel a la clientela, se comprara aretes, collares, maquillajes, labiales, entre otros productos que sean necesarias para poder darle continuidad a su trabajo.

Con el credito anterior aumentó el negocio por eso se ha decidido a seguir trabajando con kiva, variando sus productos ya que esto le permite mantenerse con sus clientes, en este periodo ha tenido problemas de enfermedades familia pero ella sigue trabajando para poderle generar una condición más estable.
texts.en:
Leonor is requesting a new loan due to her need to return to investing in plated products and cosmetics that are necessary to stay loyal to her clientele. She will buy earrings, necklaces, make up and lipstick, among other products that are necessary for her to be able to continue her work.

With her previous loan she augmented her business. Given this, she has decided to continue working with Kiva, diversifying her products because this allows her to maintain her customers. She currently has problems of family sicknesses but continues working in order to create a more stable situation.

loans.use: To buy earrings, necklaces, make up and lipstick.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона  работает на нескольких местах. Она занимается шитьем  европейской  и национальной одежды, также работает парикмахершей в  женском салоне два дня в неделю. На её плечах  лежит  и магазин хозяйственных товаров который принадлежит её семье. Её  семья очень  гордится  и поддерживают её во всех её начинаниях. Сейчас она обратилась за займом для купли продажи посуды с целью расширения бизнеса.  Давайте поддержим эту талантливую девушку и в этом.
texts.en: Farzona works in several places. She sews western and national clothing, also works as a hair stylist in a salon two times a week. Also on her shoulders is the management of a grocery and household items store which belongs to her family. Her family is very proud of Farzona and supports her in everything. Currently Farzona is requesting a loan to purchase dishes in order to expand the store's inventory. Please support this talented young woman!

loans.use: To buy dishes in order to expand her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 35 years old and married. She has six children between the ages of 18 and 2. Jane is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy two bags of fertilizers and pesticides. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to expand her farming business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy two bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is married to a pastor and they are blessed with four children who are all in school. They live in Likoni, a town in the outskirts of the city of Mombasa, in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Mildred is a primary school teacher who decided to exercise the educational leadership skills she acquired in college and she now operates a private primary school. 

Mildred states that she has an increasing number of pupils every year thanks to her devoted teachers who stick to their professionalism. However, Mildred narrates that her major challenge is that some of the parents are reluctant in paying fees to their children. The funding requested will be used to invest in her business by buying teaching materials such as books and other stationary.

loans.use: buying teaching materials such as books and other stationary.

loans.name: James Wanyoike

texts.en:
James used his previous loan amount to build a new workshop in Naivasha town. This saw his business grow and he made more income and was able to pay all the loan amount.  From the workshop, he makes carpentry items such as wall units, tables, chairs and beds.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy carpentry materials, like timber, nails, toolboxes, sandpapers, paint and brushes for painting among other things.  With the anticipated profits, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, James would like grow his business, make more income and to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, está solicitando nuevo préstamo para poder aumentar la rentabilidad del taller automotriz, comprándose una variedad de repuestos para vehículos como por ejemplo carburadores, empaques, entre otros que se pueden mencionar y que son de la necesidad de los clientes.

El manifiesta que el credito anterior le aumentó la capacidad de respuesta para los trabajos a los clientes, brindándole una variedad de repuestos que le han dado un efecto de crecimiento en el número de clientes, ha podido tener mejores ganancias para su familia hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Francisco is requesting a new loan to be able to increase the profitability of his auto mechanic shop by purchasing a variety of replacement parts for vehicles, including carburetors and gaskets, among others that could be mentioned and which his customers need.

He says that his previous loan increased his ability to respond to his customers needs, offering them a variety of replacement parts which in turn has provided him with an increased number of customers. He has been able to earn more income for his family up to this time.

loans.use: to purchase carburetors and gaskets.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La cliente doña julia es una persona digna de admiración y respeto que emigró del oriente boliviano en busca de mejores alternativas de vida. Aquí en Cochabamba conoció a su marido Carlos trabajando juntos para una empresa de serigrafía. Pasaron los años y decidieron independizarse y formar su empresa ya que conocían el negocio de la serigrafía y tenían varios años de experiencia. Con dedicación, al pasar el tiempo les fue bien y su negocio creció. Ahora, con su esfuerzo y trabajo compraron un auto, en el cual trabaja Carlos como taxista en los días que no tiene trabajo en la serigrafía. Quieren crecer en su empresa, pero para tomar contratos más grandes les falta capital de trabajo, motivo por el cual solicitan el presente crédito, porque en la actualidad existen varios contratos para realizar serigrafías pero a ellos les falta materiales como pinturas, marcos, tinner y otros.
texts.en:
Doña Julia is a client and a decent individual who is worthy of admiration and respect. She left western Bolivia in search of a better way of life. Once she was in Cochabamba, she met her husband Carlos at the serigraph company where they worked together. After time passed, they decided to become independent and start their own business since they knew the trade and had several years of experience. With dedication, they have done well over time and their business has grown. Through their efforts and work, they were able to buy a car that Carlos now uses in his job as a taxi driver on those days when he is not working on serigraphs.

Julia and her husband want to grow their business. They have accepted larger contracts, but lack operating capital. For this reason, Julia is requesting this current loan in order to acquire supplies that they are lacking such as paints, frames, thinners, and other materials so that they can produce serigraphs and fulfill their existing contracts.

loans.use: to buy paints, frames, thinners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is 45 years-old and married to John, who is a retired engineer. They have six children who are already grown. Mejumaa started her charcoal selling business more than ten years ago. Thanks to their perseverance and commitment, Mejumaa and her husband were able to nurture their six children. They are now adults and each one has a job except the last born who still depends on her parents.
 
As a result of her good service and friendliness, along with help from her family, her business is improving with each moment. Her goals are to continue working, feel useful, and move forward. Mejumaa needs a loan to buy 20 sacks of charcoal to restock her business. She and her husband are grateful for the help they have received and view it as a good opportunity to make progress. 

They live in their own house that has electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal to restock her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years-old, married to Joyce and they have four children who are aged between six years-old and 18 years-old.

Francis has a grocery business that he has been doing for the past 14 years.  He has applied for his first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD in order to enable him to buy 20 bags of potatoes to sell. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to educate his children up to university in the near future.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Brigit

texts.en:
Brigit is a 54-year-old single mother with one child. They live together in a rental house in the city of Mombasa.

Brigit has a small tailoring shop that she runs full time through the week, apart from Sunday when she goes to church. At times she is also available on Sundays after church, whenever her customers need her, and she also makes house calls when her customers are unable to come to her.

Brigit is very well known in her neighborhood and comes with very good references from her customers and neighbors. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a large variety of clothing materials and sewing thread, so that her customers will always be able to find what they need.

She is a woman who puts a great emphasis on doing her job well so that her customer base will grow, or at the very least remain stable. 

She hopes to open a boutique in the future so as to stock more variety of items to continue satisfying her customer needs.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of clothing materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 29 years-old and married to Mary.  They do not have children yet. 

Zakaria has a transport business and mainly owns a motorbike. He has applied for his first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD in order to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike.

He hopes to buy rickshaws in the near future in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 40 years old. She is married to Robert and together they have three children aged 23, 21, and 12 years old. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. 

She will use the loan amount to purchase more clothes for stock in her business.

She hopes to grow her business and open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for stock in her business.

loans.name: Muhamet

texts.en:
Muhamet is married and he has two children. He lives in Kosovo. He started to work as a glass cutter.  

He had a previous loan from KosInvest that he payed back. Muhamed is very happy with KosInvest’s support because he managed to expand his business by making doors and windows, which he sells in his area.

Now he requests a loan for the first time through Kiva to buy another machine for making doors and windows which will increase his income.

He is very optimistic that he can still enlarge his business by selling the doors and windows in the whole region of Kosovo. In this way he can improve the life conditions and have a decent life for his family.

loans.use: to buy another machine for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 from her business.

This is her fist loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan to purchase poultry feed and also add more stock chicks. She hopes to diversify her business by opening a cereal shop

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and also add more stock chicks.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la mercadería del negocio, pues considera que debe realizar una pequeña inversión en póster, pulseras, calcomanías,lamparitas, y otros que son del gusto de los jóvenes y de los niños, éste le ayudará para poder mantenerse en el negocio y también mantener la preferencia de los clientes.

Con el credito anterior fortaleció el inventario del negocio, en este período se ha mantenido vendiendo y ganándose una buena clientela, esto le ha ayudado a poder fortalecerse económicamente estabilizar su situación familiar.
texts.en:
Claudiais asking for a new loan to invest in merchandise for her business, since she thinks she should make an investment in posters, bracelets, lamps, and other items that are liked by youth and children.  This will help her to stay in business and meet her customers' preferences.

With her last loan, she strengthened her business' inventory.  During this time, she continued her sales and created a good customer base, and this has allowed her to establish economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy posters, bracelets, and decals.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo ya que quiere alquilar un terreno de pastos para el mantenimiento del ganado, en este terreno podrá ingresar al ganado para que se mantenga alimentándose del pasto y poderlo vender a futuro.

El considera que con el crédito anterior incrementó su situación en la ganadería, esto le ha dado hasta el momento buenos resultados con mayor rentabilidad, en su hogar sus condiciones de vida han mejorado, su hija ha logrado finalizar sus estudios y esto considera que ha sido a través de su esfuerzo y los préstamos.
texts.en:
Rafael is requesting a new loan because he wants to rent pasture land for the maintenance of his cattle. He will have the cattle on this land so that they continue feeding off of grass and to be able to sell them in the future.

He considers that the previous loan improved his cattle raising situation. Up to this moment this has given him good results with greater profitability and improved household conditions. His daughter had been able to finish her studies and he considers this to have been due to his efforts and the loans.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the pasture land for his cattle.

loans.name: Valdet

texts.en:
Valdet is from Kosovo. He is a single man. Over the years, his family has made a living through farming. At the moment he has one cow. Valdet uses the cow for producing and selling milk, cheese, and yogurt for the others in his area.

Valdet is applying for a loan from KosInvest to buy another cow. With the help of the loan, he will be able to sell more milk products. He believes that by selling more milk and milk products he can earn enough money. In the near future, Valdet hopes to get married and have children.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married to a primary school teacher and they decided to open a preparatory school in their neighborhood. She has dedicated herself to study and has a good knowledge of Educational Leadership. She states that she has been increasing the number of pupils every year. She says that this is attributed to the fact that her school has very devoted teachers who stick to their professionalism.

Thanks to her first loan, Mwanaisha was able to increase the enrollment in her school by constructing a classroom. However, she says that her major challenge is that some of the parents are reluctant to pay fees for their children. The loan requested will be used to invest in her business by buying teaching materials and renovating a classroom.

loans.use: to buy teaching materials and renovate a classroom.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, who has a quarry business, is 34 years old and married to Maureen, who is a business lady. They live in Naivasha town and they have one child. Joseph sells and supplies the building materials to various construction sites and it has been profitable.

This being his second loan, Joseph plans to use the amount to buy building blocks and have enough stock to sell to his customers. With the anticipated income he plans to buy a plot.

In the future, Joseph hopes to grow his business and make more income so as to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy building blocks.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, se encuentra administrando siempre su tienda, hoy en día está interesada en un nuevo préstamo que le permita comprarse más artículos para variar la tienda, productos no perecederos como las pastas, arroz, frijoles, detergentes, así como también el pan, boquitas y galletas, con la intención de mantener la preferencia de sus clientes.

Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logró dar un efecto positivo a sus ganancias a través de la compra de mercadería aumentando la disponibilidad para sus clientes, esto le ha dado mayor oportunidad de ventas y poder tener una mejor estabilidad de la familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is always tending to her store. These days, she is interested in a new loan that will allow her to purchase more items to offer more variety in her store, non-perishable items such as noodles, rice, beans, and detergents, as well as bread, snacks, and cookies. Her desire is to maintain her customer base.

She says that her previous loan helped her to see a positive effect in her earnings through the purchase of merchandise which increased product availability for her customers, which in turn provided her with a better opportunity to make sales and be able to have more stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, beans, detergents, and bread.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town where she plants cash crops such as maize, potatoes, and beans. She is 39 years old, married to David, and they have four children.

This will be her first loan amount and she plans to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for planting during this rainy season. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her farming by planting more cash crops.

In the future, Mary hopes to invest more in her farming business and make more income; hence improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Mwatsuma

texts.en:
Mwatsuma is a hardworking and caring father. His wife is a very industrious person who wants to support her family with good conditions and hard work. She does farming and sells her farm produce from her home.

As a responsible man, Mwatsuma decided to start a fish selling business, a business he has run for more than five years so as to help support the family. He began to engage in the purchase and sale of fried fish. 

His place of trade is located in the central market of the Likoni region. 

He brings fresh fish which he later fries, and this attracts many buyers. He gets his products from the fishmongers. 

Thanks for his first loan, which helped him increase his purchases. He is now applying for a second loan to purchase more fish for sale. He is so grateful to Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Ofelia Mabel

texts.es:
Ofelia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderse comprar una variedad de fruta fresca para el negocio, considera que necesita de una nueva inversión para poder atraer a sus clientes, un ejemplo de lo que ella podrá comprarse son bananas, fresas, peras, entre otro tipo de fruta que existe y que son de la preferencia de los clientes.

Con el credito anterior logró tener una mejor variedad que hasta el momento le ha ayudado a mantenerse en sus ventas, ya que ha tenido disponibilidad para poder realizar pequeñas inversiones, en su familia su circunstancia se mantiene pero ella poco a poco se va desarrollando el negocio.
texts.en:
Ofelia is requesting a new loan to be able to purchase a variety of fresh fruit for her business. She believes she needs a new investment to be able to attract new customers. For example, she will be able to purchase bananas, strawberries, and pears, among other types of fruit that her customers prefer.

With her previous loan she managed to offer a better variety that up till now has helped her to maintain sales due to the fact that she has had the product availability to be able to make small investments. Her family situation continues to be the same, but little by little her business is developing.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, strawberries, and pears.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 56 years old, married to Elizabeth, and blessed with seven children, whom he supports.  A potato farmer for the last 15 years in the Noseyia area in Narok, he earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

Josphat is now requesting his first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD to facilitate land preparation and to purchase farm inputs to help get better yields. He intends to use the anticipated new profits to help support his business and better provide for basic family needs. His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Hatima

texts.en:
Hatima is married with three children who attend school.  She is a woman of ideas. If you had a discussion with her you would be satisfied because she is a modern woman with an interesting and kind character.   Hatima lives in Likoni, the out-skirts of Mombasa city, in her own house that has both electricity and piped water.  She always has the desire to discover new ways of doing business. 

Her skills and experiences help her perfect her business skills of operating a food stall that is located at a strategic point along a busy street. 

During the last ten years, Hatima has been busy selling food products in this stall.  Her customers are very pleased with her work. 

She is requesting a loan to buy goods such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and other items so as to widen her assortment.

loans.use: to buy goods such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and other items so as to widen her assortment.

loans.name: Hidavere

texts.en:
Hidavere is from Kosovo. She is married and she has three children. She lives in the village. The main source of her family's income is a farm. Hidavere wants to expand her farm, but she needs more funds. 

It is important for Hidavere to be able to produce and sell more agricultural products and get more income. 
She requests a loan from KosInvest to purchase another cow. She sells milk to her neighbors to cover costs and ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Kumrije

texts.en:
Kumrije lives in Kosovo with her husband and four children.  She has more than five years of experience planting and selling fruit. 

The loan from KosInvest will help her buy an irrigation machine to increase the yield of her copy.  Kumrije is very charismatic and she feels that her business is going well because her customers are very satisfied.

Kumrije also hopes to own a large parcel of land to grow more, enabling her to improve the quality life for her family and educate her children.

She is very happy and grateful with the loan from KosInvest because she can plant and sell more fruit.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation machine.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 52 years old.  He is married to Mary and together they have five children.  He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 12 years.  He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from his business.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He paid his previous loan well and in good time.  He will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and pesticides.

He hopes to open a cereals shop for his wife in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Lascala Group

texts.en: Christiana (pictured center) is a member of the Lascala group, which is located in the Teshie district of Accra, Ghana. Christiana has been selling secondhand clothing for the past 7 years. Christiana is married and her husband is a security guard.  Her two children are aged 18 and 4. Christiana successfully paid back her first two loans with ID Ghana, making this her third loan cycle. With this 500 GHS loan she will buy jerseys, socks, and shirts to increase her store's stock and profits.

loans.use: To buy jerseys, socks, and shirts to increase her store's stock and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 50 year-old widow from Likoni, Mombasa, Kenya who has eight children; one is in school while the others are grown up.  Four of her children still depend and the others are married and have their own families. 

Mwanasha has sold food stuffs in the open air for seven years.  She says she uses her skills from high school when doing home food science. She works together with her two daughters and make various foods and later go outside to sell them. 

One of her advantages is that she has many clients, but it is difficult for her to get around without a mode of transport and she struggles with changes in the weather. 

The loan that Mwanasha is asking for is to supply her business with products such as flour, cooking oil, and firewood. 

Mwanasha’s greatest desire is to expand her business and transform it to a cafe in the future.

loans.use: to supply her business with products such as flour, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues necesita invertir en el negocio del cultivo de chile, ya que está iniciando la siembra y para esto comprará los foliares necesarias para poder darle los cuidados a la producción y prevenirlo de las plagas.

Para él estos préstamos son una gran ayuda, pues ayudan a mejorar también la producción de Chile realizando mejores ventas a sus clientes, gracias a los créditos de kiva están mejorando sus cosechas y está mejorando su situación como agricultor
texts.en:
Jesús is requesting a new loan, as he needs to invest in his business of growing chili peppers. He is beginning his planting, and for this he will buy the foliar fertilizers he needs in order to take care of his crop and prevent pests.

These loans are a great help to him, as they help improve his chili pepper production, and improve his sales to customers. Thanks to the Kiva loans, his harvests are improving and he is improving his situation as a farmer.

loans.use: To buy foliar fertilizers.

loans.name: Ryshyt

texts.en:
Ryshyt is a hard worker. He lives in Kosovo with his wife and seven children.  He works at a car wash.

This is his first request for loan in KosInvest.  With this loan he will buy a new machine for washing cars.  With the new machine he will work faster and he can have more clients.

His goal is to grow his business and provide more income in order to secure the future for his family and children.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for washing cars.

loans.name: Liidon

texts.en:
Liidon is a single man. He lives with his family in Kosovo. He buys scrap paper from markets and sells it to companies who do recycling.  He buys with cheaper price and then he sells for a higher price.

He requests a loan from Kiva to buy more scrap paper. With the help of the loan he will be able to sell more and to increase his profit and to secure his future.

loans.use: To buy scrap paper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of buckets, plastic basins and plates among other items to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is from Kosovo and she is living in a Serbian community. She is married and is a mother of one child. She is working hard on her land together with her husband. She has been busy with this kind of business for a long time.

Agriculture is the main source of income for Marina’s family.  She requests a loan from KosInvest to buy agricultural machinery. Marina and her husband are earning money by working on neighbors' land. 

She is very grateful for the financial support given to her to help her family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural machinery

loans.name: Ergin

texts.en:
Ergin is from Kosovo. He is living in a Roma community. Ergin has a small business selling plastic bags in different shops and markets. This is in high demand. He supplies shops in his area by bicycle. He requested a loan from KosInvest to buy more plastic bags and increase his business.  With this business, Ergin provides proper living conditions for his family.

His dream is to expand and develop his business, attracting new customers and keeping his established customer base by delivering plastic bags.
Ergin is grateful to receive this loan.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bags

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 50 years old.  She is a single, beautiful, enterprising lady who decided to take risks by opening a food stall .She started her food stall more than 15 years ago.  As a result of Mwanakombo's good service and friendliness, along with help from her brothers, her business is improving with each moment. Her goals are to continue working, feel useful, and move forward. 

She needs a loan to buy rice, beans, and flour to restock her business since these are the products that sell the most. She is grateful for the help she has received and views it as a good opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and flour

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old, married to Tilas and both blessed with five children ages 10 to 18.  

She has operated a poultry business for six years earning a monthly income of KES 29,000.

Mary has borrowed a third loan of KES.100,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. 

The anticipated profit will be used to develop her plot and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 28 years old and has been a merchant for the last three years.  She is hardworking and dedicated.  Asha is married to Juma and has one infant child. 

She says she never had the opportunity to study beyond primary level.  Therefore, her greatest wish is to see all of her children become professionals so they can have a better future.  Asha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Asha runs a food a well-stocked food stall.  Her customers are people in her neighborhood. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other basic necessity so that she can restock her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Vezire

texts.en:
Vezire lives in Kosovo, in a Roma community.  She is married and has two children. 

To support her family she has worked in agriculture for a long time. 

Vezire has two cows and can ensure income for her family by selling milk in the market. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase another cow.  Her goal is to save money to ensure a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el fortalecimiento de la granja de gallinas, pues considera necesario comprarse concentrado para alimentarlas por mayor cantidad, gallinas pequeñas y fortalcer el gallinero, también comprará materiales para la limpieza del gallinero Este crédito le ayudará con los recursos económicos para cubrir esta necesidad es un negocio y puede tener un mejor funcionamiento.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, del cual ha motivado continuar trabajando para el fortalecimiento del negocio, el desarrollo en la producción de gallinas, esto le ha ayudado también a cubrir otras necesidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Miriam is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in strengthening her poultry farm. She says that it is necessary for her to buy concentrated feed in bulk, small chickens to strengthen her flock, and cleaning supplies for her chicken coop. This loan will help provide the financial resources to help meet the needs of her business and to make it function better.

Miriam experienced positive effects from her previous loan, which motivated her to continue working in order to strengthen her business and develop her poultry production. This also helped her to cover other household necessities.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed in bulk, small chickens to strengthen her flock, and cleaning supplies for her chicken coop.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is 48 years old widow.  Her husband left her with the responsibility of raising four children, though they are now adults.

She makes a living by selling home products such as flour, rice, soda, and other small, fast selling products in a kiosk.  Thanks to this business, that she has run for the past 15 years, she has been able to meet her family's needs.  Fenny gets support from her sons.  She makes new sales and provides credit to those she trusts. This business has given her many pleasant moments.

Fenny is going to use this loan to buy rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil.  She has been with Yehu for more than a year; this pleases her because the loans allow her to finance her business. 

Her dream is to have a well stocked cereal store in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis specializes in wood carvings, and also works with leather. He would like to stock up on raw materials for use at his workshop.

Francis has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Francis comes from a family of traditional wood carvers. "While at school, funding was becoming a difficulty, so during weekends and vacations I would visit my father's workshop and assist him by carving some products for sale. The realization eventually dawned on me to stay on, work on my own designs, and display my own woodcarvings. I opened a new workshop, which my sister and a cousin manage, and together we preserve the family legacy."

"I want to thank you all for your support. Your generous assistance enables us to produce the best art works for customers around the world."

Use the link below to view Francis' carvings and leather crafts on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3835

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Rosie
