texts.en: Rosie is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 40 years old and is a married woman with 7 children. Her husband is a farmer. Rosie supports her family by selling banana cue and other local delicacies to her community. She has a monthly income of 4500 PHP. Rosie works hard to help provide for her family's needs and keep her children in school. She has requested a loan to purchase bananas, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients. Rosie hopes for her loan to help increase her sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en: Ryan is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, ages one and four. She has had a sari-sari store for four years. Ryan earns 3,000 PHP per month from selling items such as snack foods, toiletries, and canned goods. She plans to use her loan to buy rice, feed, and other items to sell. Ryan hopes for her income to increase and to be able to save for her children's future education.

loans.use: To buy rice, feed, and other items to sell

loans.name: Jeannette Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jeannette, están solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere darle continuidad al negocio en el mercado, se comprará pollos para prepararlos para la venta, también comprará los ingredientes como el aceite y los condimentos, empaques, que son necesarios para el buen funcionamiento del negocio.

Con el préstamo anterior ella ha logrado aumentar el número de clientes ya que siempre tiene disponible el pollo dorado, mejorando la calidad de preparación, esto le ha dado una mejor solvencia económica a través de las ganancias que ha obtenido por las ventas.
texts.en:
Jeannette is requesting a new loan, because she wants to keep her business at the market going. She will buy herself chickens, so that she can prepare them to sell. She will also buy the ingredients such as oil and condiments, which are necessary to keep her business running smoothly.

With the previous loan, she has succeeded in increasing her number of customers, as she always has fried chicken available. Improving the quality of preparation has given her better financial solvency, through the earnings she has obtained through sales.

loans.use: To buy chicken, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 25 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 1, 3 and 4. She has had a sari-sari store for 3 years now. She sells snack foods and canned goods and has a monthly income of 6000 PHP. She also has a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business. Catherine works hard to increase her income as she plans to save for her children's education. She has requested a loan to buy canned goods, toiletries and gasoline. This will help increase Catherine's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, toiletries and gasoline

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 42-year-old married woman with 6 children between 8 and 18 years. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mirasol supports her family selling fresh and dried fish to her community. She works hard to increase her income and help sustain her children's education. She has requested a loan to buy more fish to sell. Mirasol hopes for her family's standard of living to improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is an artisan who specializes in traditional hand-carved wood masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in strengthening his stock of products as well as developing new designs.  Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Victor was unable to study beyond elementary school due to financial difficulties. "I joined my brother-in-law, who was a master carver, specializing in traditional African objects. Since 1999, I've worked independently with ten experienced carvers. We use a hardwood known as sese for carving our masks. We use sandpaper and polish to achieve a smooth object of good quality. I use paint, metal plates and sometimes clay to decorate and preserve our works."

"I would like to convey to you my gratitude for this interest-free microcredit. May the good Lord richly bless you."

Use the link below to view Victor's wood masks, carvings and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3571

loans.use: to increase his stock of products and create new designs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He earns a living making and selling "tuba" (coconut wine) to his community. Victor works hard to increase his income and sustain his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase food coloring and coconut wine containers. Victor hopes for his business and his family's standard of living to improve in the future.

loans.use: to purchase food coloring and coconut wine containers.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is 53 years old and married. She has had a sari-sari store business for 2 years. She earns 3000 PHP each month selling snack foods, canned goods and various other items. She has requested a loan to buy rice, soft drinks and more items to sell. Carmelita hopes for her business to grow and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, softdrinks and more items to sell

loans.name: Aijan

texts.ru: Айжан 30 лет, воспитывает 2 детей. В 2004 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Айжан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду, Айжан сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 2 коровы с приплодом, 15 головы мелкого рогатого скота, 2 лошади, 2,0 га орошаемой земли с фасолью и картофелем, ежемесячный доход составляет сумму около 3,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айжан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота и удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Айжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Aijan is 30 years old and has two children. In 2004, in search of a source of income for her family, Aijan launched her livestock husbandry and farming business with a starting sum of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her dedication and tireless work, Aijan has been able to develop the business to the point where she now owns two cows and their offspring, 15 head of small livestock, two horses, and 2 hectares of land in beans and potatoes which bring her a monthly income of around 3,500 som (KGS). With the goal of further development of the business, Aijan came to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to purchase more livestock and fertilizer. Aijan plans to invest the resulting revenue into continued development of her business.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells items like coffee, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. Her income goes to food and school expenses. She would like to request a loan to buy more items to sell, such canned goods and toiletries. Jocelyn hopes for her sales to increase. She also hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en: Lorenzo is a 52-year-old married man with 2 children. He works as a farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. He grows rice crops and sells his harvest at his town's market. Lorenzo has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. He hopes to have sufficient income to buy his family's needs and expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.en:
Fabiana is an artisan who specializes in sterling silver jewelry inlaid with natural gemstones and hand-carved dried gourds. She would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of sterling silver to continue production.

Fabiana has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"I learned by watching my father at work, as well as from watching other artisans in my village. I enjoyed creating my own pieces and eventually decided to be immersed in the wonderful world of jewelry. I'm motivated by a desire to highlight women's beauty and personality through my designs and creations. I have the best job in the world, and I give it my all through patience, love and hard work in order to obtain the best quality possible."

"We're approaching that time of the year when it's our highest selling season, and I would like to be prepared for it. This interest-free microcredit loan makes it possible for me to stock up on sterling silver and gemstones so I can craft a good amount of jewelry in time. It also means I have the opportunity to develop new designs to offer to customers. I hope everyone will love my new collections! Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Fabiana's jewelry collection on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7483

loans.use: To purchase silver in bulk and prepare for the holiday season

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en: Serapio is a 56-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Serapio works hard to increase his income and have more savings. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor. Serapio hopes and prays to be blessed with children and a good business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет собственный бизнес.

Вера торгует женским бельем и купальниками на протяжении 6 лет.  Она трудолюбивая, ответственная и искренняя. Ее бизнес цель: открыть свой магазин. 

Вера просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на расширение ассортимента купальников. Часть от полученной допольнительной прибыли она потратит на отдых со свой семьей, а оставшиеся деньги вложит в бизнес.
texts.en: Vera is married, has two children, and runs her own business. She has been selling women's undergarments and swimsuits for 6 years. She is hardworking, responsible, and honest. Her business goal is to open her own store. Vera is asking for a loan of 10,000 hryvnia so that she can expand her selection of swimsuits. She is going to use part of the resulting profit to go on a vacation with her family, and the rest she will invest in the business.

loans.use: expand her swimsuit selection

loans.name: Batrice

texts.en:
Batrice lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. She has a grocery stall. She started off four months ago by using the savings she had accumulated.

Batrice admits her business faces challenges of high prices and price fluctuations; therefore, she has decided to ensure efficiency in her selling process. She is applying for a loan of 62,700 Kenya Shillings to purchase vegetables, potatoes and fruits.

The additional income will help her purchase more items, pay for her children’s education, and give them access better health facilities.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, potatoes, and fruits

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a plumber and has been in the trade for over ten years. He employs three other persons in his business. He is married and has three children in school.
Benard was introduced to Milango by a friend.  He is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional materials and tools for his business; e.g., wood, nails, pipe wrenches, etc. His ambition is to open branches in other areas in the near future.

The main challenge of the business is the delay in being paid after he completes his work. He believes the income from this business will help him educate his children.

loans.use: To buy additional materials and tools for his plumbing business.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.ru:
Марьяна замужем. У нее трое детей. Марьяна имеет собственный бизнес. 

В центре города Марьяна арендует магазин. Она продает женскую одежду и нижнее белье на протяжении 15 лет. Марьяна сталкивалась с конкуренцией, но благодаря качественному товару и гибкой системе скидок она завоевала доверее покупателей. Планы Марьяны на будущее: развить бизнес и приобрести собственный магазин. 

Марьяна просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 5000 гривен на закупку новой партии летнего товара. Дополнительную прибыль она потратит на развитие бизнеса и на образование старшей дочки.
texts.en: Maryana is married and has three children. She owns her own business in the center of the city where she rents a store. She has been selling women's clothing and undergarments for 15 years. Maryana faces competition, but thanks to her high quality goods and a flexible system of discounts she has won customers' trust. Maryana's plan for the future  is to expand the business and own her own store. Maryana is asking for a 5000 hryvnia loan to buy a new selection of summer clothing. She will use the additional revenue to develop the business and to fund her eldest daughter's education.

loans.use: buy a new selection of summer clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the coastal town of Changamwe and has a salon that has been in operation for one year. She employs one person. She is married and has one child who is in school.
 
Jane is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya Shillings to purchase beauty products like sprays, relaxers, and lotions.

She looks forward to opening a state-of-the-art and well-stocked shop in the future.

Her main challenge is the high-cost of products, although she is optimistic that through the additional income from this business, she will still be able to educate her child and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products like sprays, relaxers, and lotions

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана работает на одном из рынков своего родного города – Белая Церковь. Она торгует бакалеей. Достаточно долго, около 10 лет Светлана работала на хозяйку. Только 4 месяца назад стала работать на себя. На данный момент ее валовый доход составляет около 9 000 гривен, прибыль – около 3 000 гривен. 

Светлана хочет вложить сумму в 5 000 гривен в приобретение оборудования для нарезки сыров и колбас, а также закупить продуктовый товар. За счет полученной прибыли Светлана надеется улучшить условия проживания для своей семьи и продолжать развивать свой бизнес. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Svetlana works at one of the markets in her hometown - Belaya Tserkov.  She sells groceries.  For a long time, about 10 years, Svetlana worked for an owner.  She started working for herself only 4 months ago.  At the moment her gross income is around 9,000 hryvnia and profit is around 3,000 hryvnia.

Svetlana would like to invest a sum of 5,000 hryvnia in the purchase of equipment to cut cheese and sausages and also to purchase groceries for sale.  Svetlana hopes to use the profits to improve the living conditions for her family and to continue growing her business. 
Note: the story is in Russian

loans.use: to purchase equipment for cutting cheese and sausages

loans.name: Randu

texts.en:
Randu is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He runs a retail shop that has been in operation for two years. His business is located in an area that is normally visited by truck drivers and links two Kenyan cities. He is married and has two children. He received his start-up capital from his savings. This is the second loan he has applied for since joining Milango.

Randu joined Milango based upon a recommendation by his friends. He is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya Shillings to add retail items for a new shop he intends to open. The only challenges for his business have been the high-cost of retail items and price fluctuations. He believes his business will grow, and he will soon have a chain of businesses.

loans.use: To add retail items for a new shop he intends to open

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Использовав предыдущий кредит от КИВА, Оксана смогла удержаться на плаву в тяжелое и застойное зимнее время. Полученные средства помогли ей финансово стабилизироваться с помощью хорошей выручки. В остальном в бизнесе не произошло особых изменений.
Оксана надеется вложить нынешний кредит КИВА в размере 6 000 гривен в закупку товара.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Having used a previous loan from Kiva, Oksana was able to stay afloat during the slow, hard winter season. The funds received and strong earnings have helped her maintain financial stability. Otherwise the business has not changed. Oksana is hoping to invest this 6000 hryvnia loan from Kiva into buying goods.

loans.use: buy a new selection of goods

loans.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She has five children, two of whom are in school.  She runs a motorcycle transport business in the area. This mode of transport is preferred by many who lack enough money for other transport and also preferred for short trips in the area. She began the business two years ago. 

Besides this business, Mumbi also sells charcoal.   She was introduced to Milango by friends.  She is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to add more stock of charcoal. Her ambition is to purchase a fleet of vehicles for business in the area.

Mumbi will save the additional income obtained from this loan and use it to improve the life of her family. The challenge with the current business occurs during rainy seasons when her stock of charcoal goes down while demand is quite high and when fewer customers travel through motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pavel

texts.ru:
Павел женат.  У него пять детей. Павел имеет собственный бизнес.

Павел предоставляет услуги по изготовлению и установке деревянных лестниц. Также он изготовляет из дерева перила, поддоконики, столешницы и многое другое. Мастерская находится у него дома.  Павел обучает своих сыновей этому делу, так как хочет передать им бизнес со временем. Он ответветственный и трудолюбивый. 

Павел просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на покупку фрезеровального станка для работы по дереву. Дополнительную прибыль он собирается вложить в бизнес, помочь сыну с образованием и помочь дочке с постройкой дома.
texts.en:
Pavel is married, has five children, and owns his own business. 

Pavel makes and installs wooden stairs, window sills, table tops, and many other things. His workshop is in his home. He is teaching his sons the trade, as he wants to pass the business on to them in time. He is responsible and hard working. 

Pavel is asking for a 5000 hryvnia loan so that he can buy a milling machine for his work with wood. He plans to invest the resulting revenues into his business, as well has help with a son's education and help with his daughter's home construction.

loans.use: buy a milling maching for processing wood

loans.name: Hava

texts.en:
Hava is from Kosovo. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 18 years old and the youngest 6 years old. Hava makes a living by selling fast food chicken and fries. She is a hardworking woman. 

She started her business five years ago. She makes a good income since she always has customers to eat what she makes. She is requesting this loan to buy tables and chairs for her food stand. 

The location is set near the school and her customers are mostly students. Their menu focuses on light and healthy meals. Hava is a charismatic saleswoman. She makes delicious food. This is why her customers prefer her.

Through this business she hopes to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав женат. У него взрослая дочка. Ярослав имеет собственный бизнес.

Ярослав продает продукты питания, которые он развозит по области на своей машине. Торгует прямо с машины. Он занимается этим делом на проятжении 8 лет. Ярослав всегда продает качественный товар и поэтому покупатели доверяют ему. 

Ярослав просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 7000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента товара. Кредит поможет ему увеличить оборот и получить дополнительную прибыль. В планы Ярослава входит развивать бизнес и помочь молодой семье его дочери построить свой дом.
texts.en:
Yaroslav is married and has a grown daughter. He owns his own business. 

Yaroslav sells groceries, which he moves around the district in his car. He sells straight from the vehicle. He has been doing this for eight years. Customers trust him because he always sells quality goods. 

Yaroslav is asking for a 7000 hryvnia loan to expand his inventory. The loan will help him increase turnover and earn additional income. He plans to expand his business and help his daughter's young family build a house.

loans.use: expand his inventory

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Timothy sells clothes, shoes, and handbags. He started the business from his own savings, and it has been running five years. Besides this, Timothy is also employed as a three-wheeler driver in Changamwe, a trade he undertook to supplement his income.

Timothy is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase more clothes and shoes. His  ambition is to own a three-wheeler, despite the challenge of some clients not paying on time. The additional income from the loan will help Timothy educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.ru:
Вадим живет и работает в Новой Каховке. Он принимает заказы на изготовление металлопластиковых конструкций, ворот, а также занимается натяжными потолками, устанавливать которые ему помогает бригада наемных рабочих. Вадим арендует офис в центре города, также у него имеется склад.  

Вадиму необходим кредит в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести инструмента для монтажа подвесного потолка, а именно тепловую пушку, 2 болгарки, перфоратор, газовые баллоны, а также часть этой суммы  пойдет на зарплату рабочим, рекламу и транспортные расходы. Дополнительную прибыль Вадим планирует вложить в бизнес и потратить часть на нужды семьи. Со временем Вадим хочет развивать параллельные направления, так как наблюдает ослабление спроса на металлопластиковые изделия. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vadim lives and works in Novaya Kahovka. He does contract work producing of metal and plastic structures and gates, and also does casement ceilings, which a team of hired workers help him install. Vadim rents and office in the city's downtown and also has a warehouse. 

Vadim needs a 15,000 hryvnia loan to purchase equipment for installing suspended ceilings, in particular a heat gun, two grinder, a punch, and gas cylinders. Part of the total will also go to workers' salaries, advertisement, and transportation expenses. Vadim plans to invest the increased revenue earned into the business and use part of it for his family's needs. In time Vadim would like to expand in a parallel direction, as he sees that demand for metal and plastic construction is weakening.

loans.use: purchase construction equipment

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a carpenter who lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He has been involved in this trade for the last seven years. He does wood work and employs two other people in his business.  Samuel makes furniture of all types; he does general construction, and he also looks for and fulfills tenders for additional work.

Samuel is married and has two children in school. Samuel was introduced to Milango by a friend.  He is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings to purchase more materials for his business, such as wood and nails.  His ambition is to construct his own rental houses.

The main challenges of the business are price fluctuations and the seasonality of customers. He believes the income from this business will help him educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his carrpentry business, such as wood and nails.

loans.name: Ana Esther

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para utilizarlo en surtir el negocio, comparando este ropa nueva, blusas, faldas pantalones, y otras prendas que sean necesarias para poder atender mejor la demanda de los clientes, este credito le ayudará a tener una mejor condición en el negocio.

He tenido una experiencia positiva con el decreto anterior realizan una buena inversión en calzado de diferentes estilos, hasta la fecha su familia se ha mantenido, los artículos en el negocio están mejorando, ya que está agregando otros rubros al negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan, so that she can use it to stock her business by buying new clothing such as blouses, pants, and other articles of clothing as necessary. This is in order to better serve customer demand. This loan will help her to have her business in a better state.

She has had a positive experience with the earlier loan, making a considerable investment in footwear of various styles. To date, her family has supported itself, and the goods in the store are improving, as she is adding other product lines to the business.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay laborers, and pay for leasing land.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.ru:
Степан – из Виноградово, Западная Украина. У него есть семья, трое детей. Степан занимается установкой и монтажом сантехнических систем, проводить отопление в домах и квартирах, а также проводит воду и канализацию. Степан уже 11 лет занимается этим бизнесом. После армии сначала занимался этим делом, работая на предприятии. В 2000 году стал работать на себя. Очень хорошо разбирается в вопросах строительства и ремонта. 

Степан планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 21 000 гривен в приобретении паяльника для спаивания труб большого диаметра, а также более мощного отбойного молотка (43-45 Дж) стоимостью 12 000 гривен. Совсем недавно Степан получил заказ на проведение отопления и сантехнических коммуникаций в одном жилом доме, поэтому и потребовались более профессиональные инструменты. Деньги, полученные от завершения заказа, Степан намерен снова вложить в свое дело, использовав небольшую часть из этой суммы на летний отдых с семьей. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Stepan is from Vinogradovo in Western Ukraine. He has a family with three children. Stepan installs and assembles plumbing and heating systems in houses and apartments, and and can connect water and sewer lines. He has already been in this business for 11 years. After being in the army he began doing this work for a company. In 2000 he began to work independently. He is doing well in areas of construction and remodeling. 

Stepan plans to invest a 21,000 hryvnia loan from Kiva into getting a soldering iron for soldering large diameter pipe, and a more powerful jackhammer (43-45 ft lbs. impact energy) which costs 12,000 hryvnia. Stepan recently received a contract to connect heating and plumbing for a house which will require him to have more professional equipment. Stepan plans to reinvest the money he earns from the contact into his work, using a small part of it for a summer vacation with his family.

loans.use: buy a solderer and jackhammer

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, tiene el plan de surtir la tienda de mayores productos, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a poder adquirir los productos más necesarios, las golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, agua, granos básicos, ya que actualmente está bajando su inventario de productos y cree necesario realizar una nueva compra.

Con el préstamo anterior realizó también una compra que fue muy efectiva para mejorar su atención a los clientes, hasta el momento le ha permitido mantenerse en las ventas y le ha ayudado también a que su familia este en una condición estable económicamente.
texts.en:
María has a plan to stock her store with more products. For this, she is applying for a loan that will help her buy the most necessary products: candy, soft drinks, juices, water and staple grains. This is because her product inventory is decreasing and she believes it necessary to undertake a new purchase.

With the previous loan, she also made a purchase that was very effective in improving her service to customers. So far, it has allowed her remain in the store business, and has also helped her family to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy candy, soft drinks, juices, water and staple grains.

loans.name: Maribel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maribel, debido a la necesidad de iniciar una nueva siembra de hortalizas y de maíz, se ha acercado a solicitar un nuevo préstamo del cual comprará el abono, foliares, herbicidas, que son necesarios para poder iniciar su trabajo en la agricultura, este nuevo préstamo le ayudará a poder ejecutar su trabajo del cual ha logrado sobrevivir.

Ella manifiesta que gracias al crédito KIVA, se ha podido mantener en agricultura realizando buenas siembras de la que obtuvo un buen resultado en la venta, tuvo unos pequeños retrasos pero realizó toda la venta de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Due to the need to start a new planting of vegetables and corn, Maribel has approached the institution to apply for a new loan. With it she will buy manure, foliar fertilizers and herbicides, which she needs so that she can start her farming work. This new loan will help her carry out the work through which she has managed to survive. 

She says that thanks to the Kiva loan, she has been able to to stay in farming and carry out good plantings, from which she has obtained good sales results. She had some small delays, but did complete the sale of the harvest.

loans.use: To buy manure, foliar fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Martina Candelaria

texts.es:
Martina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para darle continuidad a la siembra de maíz, comprandose el abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, que son necesarios para proteger la plantación de las largas y fortalecerla su producción, sera de mucha ayuda pues esta actividad la realiza cada temporada.

Ella manifiesta de tenido un efecto positivo con un crédito anterior, que le ayudó a realizar una buena inversión pagando el alquiler del terreno, del la cual recibió una buena producción, en su familia se mantienen las condiciones.
texts.en:
Martina is applying for a new loan so that she can continue growing corn, by buying manure, herbicides and insecticides. These are necessary to protect the plantings from pests and build up her her production. It will be a great help, as she carries out this work every season.

She says that the previous loan had a positive effect. It helped her to undertake a good investment by paying to lease land, from which she got good production. Her family's situation remains stable.

loans.use: To buy manure, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque se le presenta la necesidad en el negocio, ya que está bajando su inventario y el considera que es necesario realizar la compra de materiales como el maíz, sal, azúcar,frijoles entre otros productos que son necesarias para diversificar el negocio, esto le ayudará a mantener su condición frente a los clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse un buen número de productos, que le han permitido hasta el momento mejorar la atención manteniendo una buena variedad, eso también ha ayudado en su familia aumentando sus condiciones económicas con relación al primer crédito.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because the need has arisen in his business. His inventory is decreasing and he considers it necessary to undertake the purchase of goods such as corn, salt, sugar, beans and other products that are needed to diversify his business. This will help him maintain the appeal of his business to customers.

With the previous loan, he managed to buy a considerable number of products, which has so far allowed him to improve service by maintaining a good variety. That has also helped his family, by improving their financial situation compared to what it was at the time of the first loan.

loans.use: To buy corn, salt, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Ramadha

texts.en:
Ramadha lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is involved in the transport industry. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. Besides this, Ramadha also runs a retail shop from where he sells charcoal and milk.

Ramadha was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access funding for his business. He is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase vehicle tyres and carry out body work on his vehicle.

Ramadha's ambitions include setting up a wholesale and well-known milk depot. The additional income from this loan will help him to meet future emergency needs. He will use the extra income to purchase fuel and other operations.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle tyres and carry out body work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Yerlis

texts.es: Yerlis de 36 años vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 13 años en la ciudad e Cartagena; allí se dedica a la actividad comercial, la cual desarrolla a un lado de su casa, vendiendo  variedades de productos tipo miscelánea como útiles escolares, papelería, artículos para el hogar vestuario femenino, masculino e infantil. También aprovecha su punto comercial para ofrecer el servicio de telecomunicaciones, mediante celulares. Sus ventas las realiza   de contado, sus clientes principales son los vecinos del sector y zonas aledañas, que encuentran en la variedad de Yerlis de todo un poco. En su actividad es apoyada por su madre, quien hace las compras a distribuidores en el mercado  y también participa en la venta de los productos, los ingresos de Yerlis dependen mucho de su negocio y por eso ella sueña con hacerlo crecer. Esta es la razón por a cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa, accesorios y artículos de uso doméstico, además de 4 planes de celulares mas, con ello estará impactando su mercado potencial y aspira a lograr un importante aumento en las ventas para obtener mas utilidades e invertirlas.
texts.en:
Yerlis is 36, and lives in the city of Cartagena with her partner and their two children, ages 12 and 13. There she has a retail business, which she runs on one side of her home, selling a variety of miscellaneous-type products such as school supplies, stationery, items for the home, as well as women's, men's and children's clothing. 

She also takes advantage of her sales location to offer telephone services using cell phones. She sells on a cash basis, and her main customers are her neighbors in that part of the city and adjoining areas, who find a little bit of everything in Yerlis' selection.

In her business she is supported by her mother, who makes the purchases from distributors in the market, and also participates in the sale of products. Yerlis' income depends greatly on her business, and that is why she dreams of making it grow. This is the reason why she is requesting a credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy clothing, accessories, items for use in the home, as well as four more cell phone plans. 

This way she will be making an impact on her potential market, and she hopes to achieve a significant increase in sales, so that she can earn more profits and invest them.

loans.use: To buy clothing, accessories, items for household use, and four more cellphone plans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another young milking cow.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 27 years old, married and has 3 children, ages 2, 7 and 9. She runs a sari-sari store business and earns 2000 PHP per month selling snack foods, toiletries and canned goods. She works hard to help provide for her family's basic needs. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, canned goods and toiletries. Lourdes hopes for her business and her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a new client from Kakuuto. He deals in cattle trading. He wants to buy more cows for trade. He wants a loan of One million Five hundred thousand shillings, over a period of ten months to boost his business.

Geofrey is married and has 6 children, 5 of whom are in school. The profit from his sales has helped him to meet his family's needs and he is able to help his extended family once in a while. His major challenge is limited capital, coupled with unpredictable weather conditions especially in the hot season. His wish is to buy a bigger piece of land, if he gets money, to keep a larger number of cows to increase his capital base.

Geoffrey is very hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Mutab Group

texts.en: This group is called Mutab. It consists of two women: Wasila and Ghadh, and two men: Ahmed and  Ali. They took a loan of 180,000 YER. Wasila is a good person. (She is the woman who stands beside a man). She is 22 years old, she is engaged and lives in Taiz, Yemen. She purchased construction supplies in order to build a kitchen room. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER to cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies, such as iron and cement. She hopes to have a big home to house her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies such as iron and cement for her business.

loans.name: Mahr Group

texts.en: This group is called “Mahr”. It is made up of two women: Suhaila and Wafa, and two men: Wafy and Wadhah, who work together in different areas. This group has initiative, values and good proposals. They have requested a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. Suhaila is 30 years old. She is the leader of this group. (In the photo she is the woman who stands beside a man.) She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She has a house. She is very grateful to her neighbors. At the present time, she needs to buy construction supplies for her house. She has applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to acquire cement and sand to renew her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house

loans.name: Amon Group

texts.en:
This group is called Amon. It is made up of 3 women: Alwiah, Fathia and Ebtsam, and one man: Najeeb. They have applied for a loan of 160,000 YER.
Alwiah is a 24-year-old mother of four children living in Aden, Yemen. She is the group leader of the loan group, requesting its first loan cycle. She is responsible for them. She is helping the family's business, which is livestock. She has been in this business for 6 years. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use her portion of the loan to buy livestock for her business, then sell to the market.

loans.use: to buy livestock for her business.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is a 67 year old woman, married and living in a rural area in Olmos, Northern Peru. Her age has given her a lot of experience and her energy seems to remain intact. This is now the second loan she is taking with Edpyme Alternativa, with the support of Kiva, having proven to be a responsible and hard working person. 

Alejandrina spends her time raising and selling sheep and cows. She explains that the animals she has, she raises from when they are of early age and, once they have become strong and developed, she sells them at the local market. Indeed, Alejandrina is well know in the local market and has a solid client base. The last loan she took was mainly for animal feed. This loan will be more directed towards the expansion of her humble business, so as to reap the benefits of what she perceives as increasing demand. Her will to improve her conditions will, no doubt, help for they contribute to her ability to succeed.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her livestock and perhaps new animals, such as turkeys.

loans.name: Alzhor Group

texts.en:
The five members of the Alzhor Group are mainly married women, named Hana, Fatom, Zainb, Amal and Mriam. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood in the city of Hadramout, Yemen. They have many clients. The whole group took out a loan of 170,000 YER. 

Hana is 29 years old and married (she stands up in the centre). She is a person who distributes different items, such as ladies clothes, to different retail shops for resale. She would like to ask for financial assistance because her household expenses are continually increasing due to the needs of her growing children. So now, she is facing a financial shortage. Therefore, she is asking for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to buy stock of fabrics to sell for retail shops. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of fabrics to sell for retail shops.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: El señor Julian tiene 45 años de edad y convive con la señora Cirila hace 23 años. Tienen 3 hijos y uno de ellos es discapacitado. Viven en una comunidad lejana, 1ra Candelaria, a 15 km hacia el norte de Colomi. Se dedican a la actividad agrícola y anualmente tienen ingresos económicos estacionales de la venta de papa, oca, papaliza y haba. Ellos cultivan sus productos en dos terrenos, uno de 5 hectáreas y otro de 3 hectáreas, herencia de sus padres. Don Julian y su esposa tienen un hijo discapacitado, debido a lo cual, durante el año tienen gastos para pago de tratamientos hospitalarios y otros. Por este motivo ellos necesitan un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico y semillas de papa, ya que es la época de siembra y necesitan con urgencia esos insumos. El señor Julian se siente animado ante la idea de poder contribuir al bienestar de su familia aumentando sus ingresos, en especial para poder usarlos en los gastos médicos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sr. Julian is 45 years old and has been in a common-law relationship with Sra. Cirila for 23 years. They have three children, one of whom is disabled. Julian and his family live in the nearby community of Candelaria, which is 15 kilometers north of Colomi. He engages in farming activities and earns yearly income by selling seasonal products such as potatoes, oca, ulluco, and beans. His crops are grown on two plots of land, one that measures five hectares and another that measures three hectares, which he inherited from his parents.

Don Julian and his wife have a son who is disabled. Throughout the year, they must pay for expenses related to his hospital treatments and other services. For this reason, they need a loan in order to buy organic compost and potato seedlings. The planting season has arrived and they are in urgent need of these supplies. Sr. Julian is encouraged by the idea of being able to contribute to the welfare of his family by increasing their income, especially for the purpose of paying his son’s medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and organic compost.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio agrícola, y así poder tener mejores resultados, se comprará los insumos como el abono y los pesticidas, que le servirán para aplicarlos a la nueva siembra evitando así se infecten de placas, este crédito será una ayuda para que el desarrollar sus actividades en el cultivo de granos básicos.

Con el crédito anterior logró tener un buen resultado, ya que su cosecha fue abundante de la cual logró realizar ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Omar is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in his farming business. He wants to have better results, so he will buy supplies such as compost and pesticides. Omar will apply these products on his new crop so that he can avoid infestation of pests. This loan will be helpful in developing his activities related to cultivating basic grains.

With his previous loan, Omar was able to achieve good results. His harvest was abundant and resulted in income for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and pesticides.

loans.name: Moises Elias

texts.es:
Moisés, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en una variedad de medicamentos naturales y químicos, que sean utilizados en diferentes enfermedades o padecimientos y los comprará en diferentes presentaciones como tabletas, inyecciones, jarabes, esto le ayudará a poder mejorar su servicio a la clientela y mantener su preferencia.

Su efecto con el préstamo anterior en el negocio fue positivo, realizando una buena inversión que le permitió mantener estable el inventario de medicamentos y poder aumentar el número de clientes que atiende.
texts.en:
Moisés is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in a variety of natural and chemical medications that are used in treating different illnesses and ailments. He will buy remedies in various forms such as tablets, injections, and syrups. This will help to improve the service he provides to his customers and to maintain their loyalty.

The effect of his previous loan on his business was positive. He achieved a good investment that allowed him to maintain a stable inventory of medicines and to increase the number of customers he serves.

loans.use: to buy medicines in the form of tablets, injections, and syrups.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción, está solicitando una prestamo, porque necesita invertir en la agricultura y la ganadería, comprándose el alimento para el ganado como el concentrado y la harinílla, forraje, también iniciará con su esposo la siembra de maíz para lo cual invertirá parte de este crédito en la compra de los insumos como el abono y los herbicidas, esto le ayudará a darle mantenimiento a dos de sus actividades con las cuales se logra mantener.

El tuvo un efecto positivo con el crédito anterior ya que se benefició al comparar el alimento para el ganado al por mayor, teniendo una mejor oferta en el precio, sus condiciones en la familia se han mantenido estables, goza de salud ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Concepción is requesting a loan because she needs to invest in her farming and livestock breeding activities. She will buy food for her cattle such as concentrated feed, processed grain, and fodder. Concepción and her husband will also begin planting corn, so she will invest part of the loan in the purchase of supplies such as compost and herbicides. The loan will help her to maintain both of these business activities.

The effect of her previous loan was positive. The benefits included being able to buy cattle feed in bulk, which enabled her to get a better price. Her family’s conditions remained stable and she and her husband enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, processed grain, fodder, compost, and herbicides.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants, les femmes du groupe Teriya habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente de pâtes alimentaires, de condiments alimentaires, des légumes, etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djeneba 2 eme femmes de la gauche vers la droite, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 30 kilos d’oignons, sur place à Sikasso, auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Djeneba compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
Predominantly married in traditional families with an average age of 36 and three children, the women in the Teriya group all live in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through family ties, as neighbours and through their professional activities.

They sell pasta, food condiments, vegetables, etc. In order to increase their working capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third credit loan cycle.

Mrs. Djeneba, second from left to right, plans to use her loan to purchase 30 kilos of onions locally from Sikasso wholesalers and conducts her sales at the market and from home, to both men and women customers.

Mrs. Djeneba expects this loan will enable her to achieve average monthly profits of 40,000 FCFA, to be reinvested in the business and to take on the household condiment needs.

loans.use: buy onions

loans.name: Siningnessigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Siningnessigui 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Dialakorosso, un des villages de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec   KEBEDIO, debout en T shirt blanc, houe au cou, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Siningnessigui 1 group are married women with an average age of 42, on average 5 children and who all live in traditional family settings in Dialakorosso, one of the villages in Kadiolo, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they are able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan with the institution, and their previous loans have all been correctly repaid.

Kebedio, standing in the picture, with the white t-shirt on and carrying the rake, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy the agricultural inputs she needs to maintain her 1.5 hectares of farmland. She sells her produce after it's harvested in the village and the Kadiolo market, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 100 000 francs per crop cycle. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos, y gracias a que se ha esforzado fuertemente durante un largo tiempo, ha logrado comprar su propia casa y allí poder montar su propio negocio el cual es una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar. Con su propia casa, la cual tiene hace 2 meses, Luis y toda su familia han podido tener una mejor calidad de vida, por esto se encuentra muy agradecido y sigue esforzándose fuertemente para seguir progresando. Debido a que su tienda la abrió con muy bajo capital, Luis busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera sus clientes encontrarán su tienda más atractiva y así sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente. Además, con mayores ingresos su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Luis is married and has three children. Thanks to his hard work over a long period of time he has managed to buy his own house and start his own business there, which is a general store where he offers staple goods. In his own house, which he has had for the past 2 months, Luis and his family have been able to have a better quality of life, for which he is very grateful and continues working very hard to keep advancing. 

Due to the fact that he started his business with very little capital, Luis is hoping that a loan will allow him to buy more staple goods to sell in his business and offer a greater variety of products to his customers. This way his customers will find his store to be more attractive and thus his sales will increase considerably. Also, with a greater income his family will be able to have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities in order to advance.

loans.use: to buy more staple goods to sell in his business and offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Siningnessigui  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Siningnessigui 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Dialakorosso, un des villages de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  NIAMA, debout au bout du rang, une grande daba en main, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, de la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, et Sikasso, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Siningnessigui 2 group are married women with an average age of 41, on average 4 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Dialakorosso, one of the villages in Kadiolo, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they are able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan with the institution and their previous loans have all been correctly repaid.

Niama, standing on the far right of the picture with a large adz in her hand, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the labourers that she needs to maintain her 1.5 hectares of farmland. She sells her produce after it's harvested in the village and at the Kadiolo market, to a customer base made up of consumers and resellers. She expects to make an average profit of 95 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as to support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay labour expenses.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando junto a sus hijos. Madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 4 hijos, debido a que su esposo murió desde hace un largo tiempo, Maria debe garantizar el sostenimiento de su hogar y por esto trabaja fuertemente en un negocio que tiene desde hace más de 15 años. Una miscelánea, donde ofrece productos de papelería, productos de uso personal, juguetes, entre otros más, es su fuente de ingresos y con esta garantiza el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a su gran experiencia, ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes para su negocio, es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo para comprar mercancía con la cual pueda estar preparada para ofrecer buenos productos a sus clientes en la temporada del día de las madres.

De esta manera podrá tener un buen surtido de productos con los cuales sus clientes logren satisfacer sus necesidades y así pueda tener unas buenas ventas. Su sueño es poder seguir teniendo un buen negocio y salir adelante con sus 4 hijos, brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Maria is a person who has had to overcome many difficulties in her life. However, she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing alongside her children. She is a single mother and head of a family with four children, as her husband passed away a long time ago. 

Maria is responsible for providing for her household, and therefore works hard in the business she has had for over 15 years. Her business is a general store, where she sells stationery, personal products, toys and other items. This is her source of income and allows her to cover her household expenses. 

Thanks to her extensive experience, Maria has won a large number of customers for her business. She is now applying for a loan so that she is ready to offer good products to her customers over the mother’s day period. As a result she will have a wide selection of products to meet the needs of her customers, and therefore have good sales. Her dream is to continue to have a good business and get ahead with her four children, offering them a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise so that she is ready to offer good products to her customers over the mother’s day period.

loans.name: Siningnessigui  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Siningnessigui 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Dialakorosso, un des villages de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec   ASSITAN , assise avec une grande daba en main, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de la semence pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, et Sikasso, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Siningnessigui 3 group are all married women with an average age of 36, on average 3 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Dialakorosso, one of the villages in Kadiolo, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they are able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan with the institution. The previous loans have all been correctly repaid.

Assitan, sitting in the picture with a large adz in her hand, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy the agricultural inputs and seeds she needs to maintain her 1.5 hectares of farmland. She sells her harvested produce in the village and at the Kadiolo and Sikasso markets, to a customer base made up of consumers and resellers. She expects to make an average profit of 80 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Luz Aide

texts.es:
Luz Aide se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo a quien siempre le ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que trabaja fuertemente en su negocio para generar ingresos con los cuales pueda tener una buena economía en su hogar. Junto con su esposo tienen una panadería que se dedica a surtir a las panaderías de su municipio, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes lo que le permite tener muy buenas ventas. La principal dificultad que han presentado en su negocio es la falta de capital para hacerlo crecer, es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar insumos y materias primas para la preparación de los panes y así poder hacer crecer su negocio respondiendo a todos los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir creciendo con su negocio brindando a sus clientes un mejor servicio y teniendo la posibilidad de responder a los pedidos que les hacen. Además, así podrá generar mejores ingresos con los cuales su hogar podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Luz Aide is married and has a son. She has always wanted to offer him a good quality of life. That is why she works hard at her business to generate income with which she can have good household finances. With her husband she has a bread bakery from which she delivers to bakeries all over town. Thanks to the good quality of her products she has been able to capture a lot of customers which allows her to have a lot of sales. The main difficulty in her business has been the lack of capital to make it grow. That is why she seeks a loan to buy ingredients and raw materials to make the bread and thus make her business grow, responding to all of the customers' orders. 

This way, she will be able to keep growing her business, offering her customers a better service and having the possibility to respond to the orders they make. In addition, she will be able to generate better income with which her household will be able to have a better quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and raw materials to make bread and thus make her business grow in order to respond to her customer's orders.

loans.name: Tièssiri I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Tièssiri I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Tiébiziédougou, un des villages de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec  Sali Seydou  assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tièssiri I group are married women with an average age of 42, on average 4 children, and who all live in polygamous families in Tiébiziédougou, one of the villages in Kadiolo, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Sali Seydou, sitting in the middle of the picture, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the labourers that she needs to maintain her 1 hectare of farmland. She sells her harvested produce in the village and at the Kadiolo market, to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 110 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay labour expenses and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Tièssiri Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Tièssiri II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Tiébiziédougou, un des villages de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec   Kadia Lassina 1ere assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tièssiri II group are married women with an average age of 41, on average 5 children, and who all live in polygamous families in Tiébiziédougou, one of the villages in Kadiolo, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they are able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution. Their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Kadia Lassina, sitting on the far right of the picture, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the labourers that she needs to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. She sells her harvested produce in the village and at the Kadiolo market, to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 110 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay labour expenses and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es:
Leocadio tiene un negocio de videojuegos desde hace aproximadamente 1 año con el cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. En su negocio tiene una cantidad de consolas de videojuego que gracias a las buenas ventas que tiene ya no son suficientes para poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes, por esto busca un préstamo para comprar una consola de videojuegos, 2 sillas y una mesa para aumentar la capacidad de su negocio para atender a sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, ya que podrá atender la gran demanda que tienen sus clientes. Además, podrá tener mejores ingresos con los que su familia tendrá la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Leocadio has had a video game arcade business for about one year. Through this business he generates the income necessary to maintain his household expenses. In his business he has a few video game consoles that, thanks to the good sales he has, are no longer sufficient in responding to the demand from his customers. 

As a result he is requesting a loan to purchase a video game console, two chairs and a table to increase the capacity of his business to serve his customers. This way he will be able to offer his customers better service as he will be able to respond to the large demand from his customers. In addition he will be able to increase his income and his family will have the opportunity to have a better quality of life and better financial opportunities in order to advance.

loans.use: to buy a video game cansole, two chairs, and a table to increase his business' capacity to serve customers.

loans.name: Tièssiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Tièssiri III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Tiébiziédougou, un des villages de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec    FATOUMATA OUMAR , 1ere assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tièssiri III group are married women with an average age of 32, on average 3 children, and who all live in polygamous families in Tiébiziédougou, one of the villages in Kadiolo, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they are able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Fatoumata Oumar, sitting on the far right of the picture, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the labourers that she needs to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. She sells her produce in the village and at the Kadiolo market after it's harvested, to a customer base composed of resellers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 160 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay labour expenses and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec   TENEBA , debout au bout du rang, une grande daba en main, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, de la semence et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, et Sikasso, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Siningnessigui 4 group are all married women with an average age of 39, on average 4 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Dialakorosso, one of the villages in Kadiolo, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th loan with the institution. Their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Teneba, standing on the far right of the picture with a large adz in her hand, farms rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the labourers that she needs to maintain her 1 hectare of farmland. She sells her harvested produce in the village and at the Kadiolo and Sikasso markets, to a customer base made up of consumers and resellers. She expects to make an average profit of 185 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay labour expenses.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The Fougnegue I group is made up of married women who all live in polygamous families in Ziangolodougou, a village in Kadiolo, the 3rd largest administrative region in Mali. The women have an average age of 42 years old, and an average of four children each. They are working with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming work during the rainy season. This is their third loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Their previous loans were correctly repaid.

The speculation cultivated is: the peanut with Kadiatou, standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seeds, and pay the labor costs for the maintenance of 4 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village, at the Kadiolo Market, to a clientele made up of consumers and resellers.

She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA per harvest. The profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs and buy inputs and seeds

loans.name: Fougnegue Ii Group

texts.fr:

La spéculation cultivée est : le riz  avec   Latadio debout au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de Kadiolo, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Fougnegue II group are married women with an average age of 43 and 5 children. They all live in polygamous families in Ziangolodougou, one of the villages in Kadiolo, the third largest administrative region of Mali.  They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization in order to conduct their agricultural businesses during the rainy season.  They are on their third loan with the institution; the prior loans were all fully repaid.  Rice is the crop planted by Latadio, who is standing in the middle of the photo.  With her loan, she plans to pay the cost of labor for maintaining two hectares. After harvest, the yield is sold at the village market in Kiadolo to a clientele of resellers and consumers.  She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA per season.  This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 5 enfants, les femmes du groupe Badenya habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  
Elles  font de la vente de condiments alimentaires, des tissus, des céréales, des poissons,  des galettes, etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Chata, 2 eme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 paniers de poissons fumé.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Sikasso, auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes, en ambulant, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame Chata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Predominantly married in traditional families with an average age of 42 and five children, the women in the Badenya group all live in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through family ties, as neighbors and through their professional activities.

They sell food condiments, fabrics, grain cereals, fish, flat-cakes, etc. To increase their working capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second credit loan cycle.

Ms. Chata, the second person from right to left in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase two baskets of smoked fish. She buys locally from Sikasso wholesalers and conducts her sales as an itinerant vendor, from home and at the market, to both men and women customers.

With this loan Ms. Chata expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, to be reinvested in the business and to deal with some of the household needs.

loans.use: Buy smoked fish

They work with the microfinanace institution Soro Yiriwaso so they can complete their agricultural work during the off season. This is their third loan with the institution. They repaid their past loans in full.

They grow corn. Djeneba Adama is in the front and middle of the photo. She would like to use her loan to pay for labor and farm inputs to maintain 2 hectares of land.

After the harvest, they sell their crops in the Kadiolo market in the village to a clientele of resellers and consumers. 

She would like to earn an average of 160.000FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: pay for labor and farm inputs.
