En su negocio ofrece productos de uso personal para damas como cremas de manos, perfumes, tratamientos para el cabello, cosméticos, entre otros más, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que permite tener muy buenas ventas. Ahora que su negocio viene creciendo, busca implementar en su negocio productos de uso personal para hombres, por esto busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de uso personal para hombres como perfumes, desodorantes, cremas de peinar, entre otros más, y así ofrecer productos para los dos géneros. 

Carlos espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente permitiendo tener así ingresos con los cuales su familia pueda tener mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Además poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de tener un progreso económico y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young entrepreneur who about five years ago started his own business. He wanted to earn his own income and contribute financially to his home to have a better quality of life, have more financial capaicty and pay for his own studies. In his business he offers personal use products for women such as hand creams, perfumes, hair treatments, cosmetics, and more. Thanks to the high quality of his products, he has been able to capture a lot of customers, which allows him to have good sales. Now that his business is growing, he is looking to start selling men's personal use products such as colognes, deodorants, hair creams, and more. This way, he can offer products to both genders. 

Carlos hopes that this way his sales will increase considerably, allowing him to have income so his family can have a better quality of life and more financial opportunities. In addition, he will little by little make his dream come true to have financial progress and pay for his own studies.

loans.use: to buy personal use products for men such as colognes, deodorants, hair creams and more. This way she can offer products to bother genders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy personal care products to fill orders.

loans.name: Salvador Arnulfo

texts.es: Arnulfo tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene seis hijos, es un hombre social, trabajador, honesto y alegre, su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar. Elnegocio lo inicio desde hace 12 años el se dedica al cultivo de café y a la cría de ganado, Arnulfo aprendió por tradición ya que su padre se dedica a estas actividades, trabaja junto a su esposa, su hijo y dos empleados temporales, siendo su conyugue quien maneja el negocio de  la pulpería y es soporte importante en el éxito de familia, la jornada de trabajo inicia a las 4:30 am y finaliza a las 3:00 pm. La mayor dificultad ha sido tener tiempo para atender estas actividades ya que también tiene trabajo en una empresa privada y eso le complica distribuir adecuadamente su tiempo. La ventaja de tener actividades productivas es que es más fácil lograr brindar salud, alimentación y educación a la familia. El préstamo que Arnulfo solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para la finca, pago mano de obra y para limpiar el potrero del ganado. Su sueño es brindar protección a su familia y poder graduar a todos sus hijos, su meta es tener solvencia económica para solucionar los gastos familiares. Este es su primer crédito que solicita en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Arnulfo is 40 years old, married, and has six children. He is a social, hard-working, honest, and cheerful man. His wife does the household chores. He started his business 12 years ago. He grows coffee and raises cattle. Arnulfo learned by tradition, as his father did this type of work. He works together with his wife, son, and two temporary employees. His wife is the one who runs their small grocery store, which is important to supporting the family's success.

His work day starts at 4:30 am and ends at 3:00 pm. His greatest difficulty has been finding enough time to tend to these activities, as he also works at a private company, which complicates the adequate distribution of his time. The advantage of having productive businesses is that it makes it easier for him to offer health, nutrition, and education to his family.

Arnulfo needs the loan he is requesting to purchase fertilizers for the field, to pay laborers, and to clean the cattle paddock. His dream is to offer his family protection and for all of his children to graduate. His goal is to have the economic solvency to take care of his family's expenses. This is Arnulfo's first loan request from FAMA and he hopes to make his repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay laborers

loans.name: Edgar De Jesus

texts.es:
Edgar se encuentra casado y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 13 y 17 años de edad, y para generar los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar trabaja en la actividad de la carpintería desde hace ya muchos años. Gracias a que cuenta con una gran experiencia ha logrado generar una muy buena reputación entre sus clientes por la buena calidad de sus productos, y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas y cada vez seguir creciendo. Adicional a esto, su esposa ha estudiado hace 6 años la misma actividad, y durante mucho tiempo ha venido trabajando a su lado para perfeccionarla, por esto ahora que puede contribuir con su trabajo para que el taller de carpintería siga creciendo, Edgar busca un préstamo para comprar 2 máquinas de carpintería para hacer crecer la capacidad de producción de su taller.

De esta manera podrá comenzar a responder a todos los pedidos que hacen sus clientes y así progresar poco a poco con su taller. Su sueño es ubicar el taller en un local mejor posicionado, ya que actualmente lo tienen en su vivienda y esta no queda en una vía principal, por lo que es un poco difícil promocionar sus productos desde allí.
texts.en:
Edgar is married with three children that are 11, 13 and 17 years old. In order to generate the income that is required for his household he has worked in carpentry for many years. Thanks to the fact that he has a lot of experience he has succeeded in creating a very good reputation among his customers for the good quality of his products and this has allowed him to have very good sales which continue to grow. In addition, his wife has studied the same business since 6 years ago and for a long she time has come to work at his side to perfect it. Because of this she can contribute with her work so that the carpentry shop continues to grow. 

Edgar seeks a loan in order to buy 2 carpentry machines in order to increase the production capacity of his shop. Through this he will be able to begin to respond to all of the orders that his customers make and as such, continue progressing little by little with his shop. His dream is locate his shop in a better situated locale since they currently have it in their home which is not on a main street. This makies it a little difficult to promote his products from there.

loans.use: to buy two carpentry machines in order to make the production capacity of his shop grow.

loans.name: Inés Del Rosario

texts.es: Inés del Rosario tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su nieto. Hace varios años empezó con un negocio el cual consiste en la venta de repuestos para vehículos. Tiene mucha experiencia en el área ya que tiene muchos años de contar con dicho negocio. Muchas personas la conocen y la prefieren ya que en su negocio pueden encontrar todo lo que buscan a los mejores precios. Además, muchas personas expresan estar satisfechas con el servicio que ofrece ya que ella siempre atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa y con mucha amabilidad.  La ubicación del negocio se encuentra en su hogar de habitación ya que como toda una mujer emprendedora ha buscado la forma de administrar su negocio en su hogar, ya que no cuenta con los recursos para tener un local exclusivo para el negocio. Sus deseos es darle mayor estabilidad, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos para accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de accesorios, repuestos y aceites para vehículos que es lo que más le demandan los clientes. De esta forma espera lograr su sueño y continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Inés del Rosario is 53 years of age, and lives in her own home with her grandson. Several years ago she started her business, where she sells spare parts for vehicles. She has lots of experience in this area, as she has had the business for many years. 

She is well-known and many people prefer to go to her, as in her business they can find all that they’re looking for at the best prices. Many customers also say that they are satisfied with the service she offers, as she always handles her customers with a smile and in a very friendly manner. The business is located in a room in her home as, being an enterprising woman, she has found the way to run her business at home as she cannot afford to rent premises exclusively for her business.

Her wish is to have a more stable business, increasing her sales and income and enjoying a better quality of life. This why she has requested this loan from INTEGRAL, to invest in her business by buying accessories, spare parts and vehicle oil, which are the products that her customers request the most. This will help her realize her dream and continue providing for her household every day.

loans.use: To buy accessories such as windscreen wipers, air fresheners, shampoo, spare parts and vehicle oil.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe   Djiguisseme 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kampogosso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  KATERINE, 2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 075 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 9 members of the Djiguisseme 3 group are married women with an average age of 40, on average 5 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Kampogosso, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution, the previous loans having been properly repaid.

Katerine, sitting second from the left in the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy small agricultural equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the labourers that she needs to maintain three quarters of a hectare of farmland. The harvested produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 115 000 francs per crop cycle. The profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Djiguisseme 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kampogosso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali.

The harvested produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a customer base composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 150 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as to support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   KADIA,  1ere  debout de la droite vers la gauche sur  la photo.

They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Kadia, standing on the far right of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy small agricultural equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain 1 hectare of farmland. After it is harvested, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 165 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Djollo Kagoua, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs  avec   HAWA,  2 eme debout au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des matériels agricoles, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 220.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who on average are 39 years old with six children, all living in traditional families in Djollo Kagoua, one of the villages of San, fourth administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to help carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Hawa grows corn, and is the second person standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs, small farming tools and seeds, and pay for plowing  to cultivate 1.5 hectare (approximately 3.7 acres).

After harvest, the crop is sold at village level and at the San market, to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average profit of 220,000 FCFA by the end of the growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for plowing, and buy agricultural inputs, small farming tools, and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Moribila Nagousso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution tous les trois prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   MEREMA, 2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Benkadi 3" are married women average 36 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Moribila Nagousso, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the off-season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The three previous loans have all been repaid without difficulty. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with MEREMA, the second woman seated from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and some seeds and to pay for plowing for maintaining 0.25 hectare. 

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of retailers and consumers. 

MEREMA expects to make an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help  out her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and some seeds

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a conservative woman, and because she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet, the photo is of her husband.

Hiba is a 21-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She lives in Baqa'a, Jordan.

Hiba is requesting a loan of 500 Jordan Dinars (JOD) so that she can improve her home living conditions, paint her house, and buy some furniture for it. Because Hiba is under 30 years old, her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions and paint her house.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Moribila Nagousso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution tous les trois prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   DJENEBA MADINA,    1ere debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women with an average age of 37, on average 6 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Moribila Nagousso, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th loan with the institution. The 3 previous loans have all been repaid without difficulty.

Djeneba Madina, standing on the far right of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the labourers needed to maintain a quarter of a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a customer base composed of resellers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 55 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a forty-two-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Zahra is hoping to have a loan of 500 JOD so that she can buy more cosmetics and perfumes for trading purposes. In the future she wants to open her own store and have her own home.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Agricultores De Capellania Ii Group

texts.es:
El señor Marto esta casado, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó el sexto grado de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos el cual estudia, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de papas tipo Icta Frit, inicio este trabajo, sembrando el el terreno de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 18 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Organza un grupo y solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizaran apara capital de trabajo, para la compra de semillas de papa Tipo Icta Frit, y la compra de fertilizante. Espera en el futuro tener mas terreno para generar mas produccion. Los demás integrantes de grupo se dedica al mismo trabajo: La siembra de papa Tipo Icta Frit.
texts.en: Marto is 36 years old and is married. He completed the sixth grade in primary school and he has one child who is in school. He makes a living in agriculture planting Icta Frit potatoes [a Guatemalan variety]. He started this work planting his parent's land and he now has 18 years of experience. He has the support of his wife who is a domestic worker. He organized this group to request a loan which he will use to set aside as working capital to purchase Icta Frit potato seeds and fertilizer. He hopes that in the future he will have more land to generate more produce. The rest of the members of the group make their living in the same type of work, planting Icta Frit potatoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  Benkadi sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles nucléaires à  Kampogosso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution et les deux prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs et Moustapha, le président du groupe, 2 eme debout avec une barbe blanche sur la photo, compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, de la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes tels Bamako, Mopti et Ségou. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group "Benkadi" are married men averaging 45 years of age and six children each living for the most part in nuclear families in Kampogosso, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is corn. Moustapha, the group's president (the second one standing in the photo with a white beard) intends to use his loan to buy farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 2 hectares.

The produce is sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed essentially of retailers from large cities, such as Bamako, Mopti, and Ségou. 

He expects to make an average profit of 300,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and also to help the extended family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and some seeds and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Dababougou Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dababougou Benkadi 7 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec   KOTIMI , 1 ere femme  debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants pour exploiter   0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 7" are married women averaging 38 years of age and six children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with KOTIMI, the first woman standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy sundry farm equipment and inputs to make use of 0.25 hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 80,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and sundry equipment

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres con iniciativa y buenas propuestas de cómo hacer negocio hoy en día, son las mujeres del grupo llamado Mujeres Activas,  conformado por  6 socias. Este grupo comienza a dar marcha hace ya 9 años. Mujeres que con esfuerzo salen a delante sin importar las adversidades que vengan en el camino. Muestra de ello es la señora Jacinta  la presidenta del grupo Mujeres Activas, de 52 años de edad conviviente y con 4 hijos todos ya mayores de edad,  ella sale adelante cada día dándole empeño y esmero a la bodega que tiene como fuente de ingresos hace mas de 7 años. Ella comenzó con este negocio propio a raíz que no alcanzaba la plata en el hogar, es así como surge bodega en su casa,  que día a día crece cada vez mas en sus ratos libres se dedica ala venta de productos de belleza. El presente préstamo lo invertirá en compras abarrotes. La señora Jacinta es solo una de las 6 integrantes que con esfuerzo y entusiasmo salen adelante para el bienestar de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en: A group of women with inicitiave and good proposals when it comes to having a business nowadays, are the women of the group called Active Women which is composed of six members. It started nine years ago. These are women who were able to suceed in spite of any obstacles that came their way. Proof of that is Mrs. Jacinta president of the group Active Women. She is 52 years old, has a partner, and has four grown-up children. Every day she works hard in the grocery store that has provided an income for more than seven years. She started this business because she did not have enough money to cover household expenditures. She built a grocery store in her home and day by day spends more hours of her free time selling cosmetics. She will use the loan to buy groceries. Mrs. Jacinta is only one of 6 members who work hard and with enthusiasm for their families' well-being.

loans.use: buy groceries

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Moribila Nagousso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution tous les trois prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  HAWA, la présidente du groupe assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 38 and an average of four children who all live in traditional families in the village of Moribila Nagousso, located in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They are cooperating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can successfully carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are requesting their fourth loan with the institution. All three previous loans have been repaid without any difficulties.
HAWA is the president of the group and is seated in the middle of the photo. She grows peanuts. She plans to use the loan to buy inputs, seed and cover the labor costs for the upkeep of 0.75 hectares.
After harvesting, the yield will be sold in the village and at the San market, to a customer-base consisting of traders and consumers.
She expects to make an average profit of 95,000 FCFA per season.
This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to cover labor costs, to buy inputs and seed

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Moribila Nagousso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution tous les trois prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   MARIAMA,  2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et semence pour entretenir : 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 2" are married women average 36 years of age and three children each all living in traditional families in Moribila Nagousso, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the off-season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The three previous loans have all been repaid without difficulty. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with MARIAMA, the second woman seated from the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and some seeds for maintaining 0.25 hectare. 

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of retailers and consumers. 

MARIAMA expects to make an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help  out her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and some seeds

loans.name: Djiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Djiguisseme 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kampogosso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec AMI YACOUBA, assise en T-shirt noir et blanc sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguisseme 2 group are married women with an average age of 39, on average 5 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Kampogosso, one of the villages in San, 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution, the 4 previous loans having been correctly repaid.

Ami Yacouba, sitting in the picture, with the black and white t-shirt on, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy small agricultural equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the labourers that she needs to maintain three quarters of a hectare of farmland. The harvested produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 115 000 francs per crop cycle. The profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as to support her husband with the daily expenditures.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Djiguisseme 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kampogosso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et les quatre prêts précédents ont été tous bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   AMI,  assise au milieu sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguisseme 4 group are married women with an average age of 28, on average 3 children, and who all live in traditional family environments in Kampogosso, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan with the institution and the previous 4 loans have all been correctly repaid.

Ami, sitting in the middle of the picture, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy small agricultural equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the labour expenses of the people needed to maintain 1.25 hectares of farmland. The harvested produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 185 000 francs per crop cycle. The profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es:
Flor es una persona que siempre se ha considerado muy trabajadora, por esto al ver que los ingresos que su esposo no eran suficientes para sostener los gastos de su hogar decidió montar su propio negocio y así contribuir económicamente con los gastos del hogar. Fue así como obtuvo un negocio que estaba disponible en el parque central de su municipio y comenzó a trabajar fuertemente para que este saliera adelante. Su negocio es un bar donde ofrece a sus clientes también juegos como billar y otros juegos de azar, y gracias a la buena atención que tiene y la buena ubicación puede tener muy buenas ventas para su negocio y esto le permite tener unos buenos ingresos para el hogar. Debido a que su negocio viene creciendo en ventas, pero no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poderlo hacer crecer, Flor busca que un préstamo le permita comprar bebidas y otros productos más que ofrece en su bar para surtirlo y ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.

De esta manera tendrá la oportunidad de seguir generando los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar para seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida, además de poder seguirle brindando a su hijo de 10 años de edad el acceso a una educación de buena calidad. Su mayor sueño es seguir teniendo su negocio ya que este le ha permitido mejorar considerablemente su condición de vida y poder en un futuro generar empleo para los más necesitados y así mejorarles la calidad de vida a otras personas.
texts.en:
Flor is someone who has always considered herself to be very hardworking and so, seeing that her husband's income was not sufficient to cover household costs, she decided to set up her own business and thus contribute financially to pay household costs. So she acquired a business that was available in the central park of her municipality and began working hard to get ahead. Her business is a bar where she also offers her customers games such as billiards and other games of chance. Thanks to her good customer service and good location she can make very good sales in her business and this allows her to have a good income for her household. Since her sales are increasing in her business but she doesn't have enough capital to make it grow, Flor is seeking a loan that would allow her to purchase drinks and other, additional products in order to stock her bar and offer her customers a good variety of items. 

In this way she will have the chance to keep generating the income that her household needs to keep having a good quality of life, in addition to being able to continue offering her ten-year-old son access to a good-quality education. Her greatest dream is to keep on in her business since it has allowed to her to make considerable improvements to her life circumstances, and to generate employment in the future for those who are most needy, in order to improve the quality of life of others.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and other products in order to stock her bar and offer her customers a good variety of products.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Moribila Nagousso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution tous les trois prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec    FATOUMATA,  2 eme assise avec une écharpe rose sur la tête sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of this Benkadi 5 group are married women with an average age of 36, four children, all living in traditional families in Moribila Nagousso, one of the villages of San, fourth administrative region of Mali. They work with the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural endeavors during the rainy season. 

They are on their fourth loan with the Institution, with the three preceding loans having been reimbursed without difficulty. The crop cultivated is peanuts, in the case of Fatoumata, the second seated in the photo with a rose-colored scarf on her head. With her loan she intends to buy inputs and seed and pay for plowing to maintain one hectare of land. 

Her produce will be sold right in the village and in the marketplace of San, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of middlemen and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 185,000 FCFA each harvest. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en: Saudah is 52 years old and a single mother of three children living in Hioma, Uganda. The responsibility of taking care of the family solely rests on her and her dream is to see all her children graduate. She is a teacher and has been teaching for 20 years. In order to supplement her monthly salary she bought a motorcycle for a transport business. She faces challenges of price fluctuations and the mechanical breakdown of her motorcycle. Her dream is to buy a taxi. Saudah intends to use the loan to repair her motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruben Darío

texts.es:
Ruben se desempeña en la actividad de la encuadernación desde hace un largo tiempo ya, lo que le permite tener muy buena experiencia en el sector y así diferenciarse ante sus clientes. Desde hace 12 años, luego de trabajar durante un largo tiempo en una empresa donde no ganaba un buen salario, decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller desde su casa y así poder progresar económicamente. Debido a que no contaba con mucho capital su negocio fue montado con muchas limitaciones de producción, por lo que en un principio sus pedidos no eran muy grandes, sin embargo con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado su negocio adelante y así poco a poco ha venido creciendo. Actualmente tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, tanto que su capacidad de producción no puede responder a la demanda de sus clientes, por esto busca que un préstamo le permita comprar 2 prensas con lo cual aumente su capacidad de producción y pueda responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá crecer más y tener mejores ventas, de modo que su familia tendrá mejores ingresos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Sus necesidades económicas son un poco altas, pues sus 2 hijas de 16 y 18 años de edad se encuentran estudiando y la universidad es muy costosa, pero gracias a su negocio les puede brindar el estudio. Su sueño es ver sus 2 hijas profesionales y tener en su hogar mejor calidad de vida y oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Ruben has worked in the binding business for a long time.  This allows him to have very good experience in the area, and that way he stands out to his customers.  He has been doing this for 12 years.  Before that he worked for a long time at a company where he did not earn a good salary.  He decided to become independent and start up his own shop at his house.  This way he was able to make financial progress.

Because he did not have a lot of capital, his business was established with a lot of production limitations.  Therefore, his orders were not very big in the beginning.   Nevertheless, he got the business ahead with great effort.   This way it has been growing little by little.  He currently has two large orders from his customers.  They are so big that he is unable to respond to the customer demand due to his production capacity.

That is why he is looking for a loan, which will allow him to buy two presses and increase his production capacity.  Then he will be able to respond to his customers’ orders.  This way he will grow more and have better sales.  His family will have improved income and a better quality of life.

His financial needs are a little high.  His two daughters, age 16 and 18, are in school, and the university is very expensive.  However, thanks to his business, his is able to give them an education.  His dream is to see his two daughters become professionals, have a better quality of life in their home, and financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy two presses and increase his production capacity and to respond to his customers' orders.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna used the previous loan to buy soft drinks, sugar and rice for sale.He is a thirty-two-year-old hard-working married man with five children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal,Uganda with a family goal of educating his children up to University.For five years he has been in farming and also has a retail shop which has facilitated him in providing the basics for the family. His mission is to become a wholesale trader although he still has challenges of insufficient capital to meet the demand of his customers.Haruna needs another loan to buy rice and sugar for sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for sell.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto desde hace 4 meses inició su tienda general en su municipio, pues aprovechó una experiencia de 12 años dedicado a la venta de comidas en los pueblos, actividad que le permitió ahorrar para iniciar la tienda actual. Anteriormente vivía en otro sector de la ciudad, pero se vio en la obligación de trasladarse por problemas que había en el sector. Con mucho esfuerzo ha levantado su hogar y debido a que no tiene historial crediticio le ha tocado recurrir a pagadiarios, a quienes les prestaba dinero pagando el 20% de interés mensual. Roberto es muy conocido en el sector por tener un gran carisma. Gracias a que su tienda general es la única en el sector le permite tener muy buenas ventas, por esto requiere un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar que ya se encuentran agotados, además de comprar una vitrina.

De esta manera Roberto espera poder iniciar con un historial crediticio que le permita tener en un futuro un mejor acceso a las entidades financieras, además de poder tener su negocio bien surtido. Su mayor anhelo es tener un minimercado dado el potencial de clientes que hay en el sector, y así generar más ingresos para su familia y también generar empleo para los más necesitados.
texts.en:
Four months ago, Roberto started up a general store business in his town, taking advantage of his 12 years of experience selling food in the towns.  It was this food business that allowed him to save up the money to start up the store he has now.  Before, he lived in another neighborhood in the city, but he saw the need to move because of problems in that neighborhood.  It took a lot of effort for him to move to a new home, and since he didn't have a credit history he had to resort to the informal lenders, paying a monthly interest rate of 20 percent.  Roberto is very well-known in the neighborhood as he is quite charismatic.  Thanks to his general store, which is the only one in the neighborhood, he is able to have very good sales.  He needs a loan for this business so that he can buy consumer staples that he is out of, and he will also buy a glass display case.

In this way, Roberto hopes to start a credit history that will allow him better access in the future to financial entities.  Also, he will be able to keep his business well-stocked.  His main wish is to have a mini-market, given the potential with the customers that are in his neighborhood.  In this way he could generate more income for his family and also generate jobs for those in greatest need.

loans.use: to buy consumer staples and a glass display case

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es: Don Facundo tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, el es un hombre muy educado, amable y responsable. Inicio desde hace muchos años a cultivar café ya que su padre le enseño a realizar esta actividad. Actualmente el se dedica a la producción de café, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm, el trabaja en conjunto con su dos hijas y dos trabajadores temporales. Una ventaja es el precio de la venta del producto ya que es favorable y le deja buenas ganancias. El problema que don Facundo tiene que enfrentarse es el cambio de clima que debido a la lluvia el grano de café se cae y esto le produce perdida. El préstamo lo solicita para invertirlo en el pago de mano de obra y en la compra de abono para darle mantenimiento a su finca y que el café sea de mayor calidad. Los sueños de don Facundo es que su grano de café sea certificado y hacer la finca orgánica, libres de abonos y fertilizantes artificiales para que el café sea cultivado con abonos naturales. Don Facundo ha sido cliente de FAMA por más de tres ciclos y ha sido un cliente que ha pagado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Don Facundo is 50 years old, married and has four children. His wife devotes herself to running the household. He is a very courteous, kindly and responsible man. He began growing coffee many years ago since his father taught him this business. Currently he earns a living producing coffee. His work schedule is from 6 a.m. until 1 p.m. He works along with his two daughters and two temporary workers. One advantage is the sales price of the product since it is favorable and leaves him a good profit. The problem that Don Facundo must face is climate change since, owing to the rain, the coffee beans fall and this produces a loss for him. 

He is seeking the loan to invest in paying for labor costs and to purchase fertilizer in order to maintain his farm and produce better-quality coffee. Don Facundo's dreams are that his coffee beans would be certified and to make his farm organic, free from artificial fertilizers so that the coffee may be grown using natural fertilizer. Don Facundo has been a client of FAMA for over three loan cycles and has been a client who has paid his installments on time.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and labor costs.

loans.name: Jaime Andres

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven emprendedor que desde muy temprana edad viene trabajando en una carnicería como ayudante, y gracias a la experiencia que había adquirido decidió montar su propia carnicería para progresar económicamente. Con su propio negocio ha tenido la oportunidad de generar mayores ingresos en su hogar, permitiendo que su hijo de 2 años de edad tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que no cuenta con suficiente capital para surtir su negocio, Jaime busca que un préstamo le permita comprar carnes para surtir su negocio y seguir brindando buena variedad de productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir teniendo en su negocio una buena atención para sus clientes y esto le permitirá tener mejores ventas. Además poco a poco irá mejorando la calidad de vida en su hogar y teniendo mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener un minimercado donde pueda generar empleo para los más necesitados.
texts.en:
Jaime is a young entrepreneur who at a very young age began working in a butcher shop as an assistant. Thanks to the experience that he had acquired, decided to start up his own butcher shop to progress financially.  With his own business he has had the opportunity to generate a better income for his household, allowing his 2-year-old son to have a better quality of life.  

Owing to the fact that he doesn't make enough capital to supply his business, Jaime is looking for a loan to buy meats to supply his business and to continue to offer a good variety of products to his customers.  That way he will continue to give good service to his customers and it will allow him to have better sales in his business.  Furthermore, little by little he will continue to improve the quality of life in his household as well as have better financial opportunities to progress.  

His biggest dream is to have a mini market where he can generate employment for those who need it most.

loans.use: to buy meats to supply his business and to continue to offer a good variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Juan tiene 32 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Renacer, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, ellos residen en la comunidad de San esteban, Olancho. Su esposa se dedica atender la pulpería y a realizar los quehaceres del hogar, Juan desde hace cinco años se dedica a la compra y venta de leche, además tiene una pequeña pulpería que cuando el no esta su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, la cual es una persona que le apoya en todo lo que ha  decidido a emprender, el sale a vender en su carro la leche desde las 6:00 am hasta las 12:00 pm y por la tarde se dedica a cuidar la pulpería. En ciertas ocasiones se le presentan algunas dificultades ya que en el verano se le complica un poco porque la producción es menor por lo tanto las ganancias se reducen. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá comprar productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, jabón, detergente, refrescos, dulces, entre otros, ya que necesita surtir la pulpería para ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten. Uno de sus desafíos es brindar a su comunidad un mejor servicio dándoles precios más bajos y una mejor atención, su meta es llegar a tener un mercadito donde el cliente pueda encontrar todo lo que necesite. Juan ha sido cliente de FAMA por más de 10 años y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and is a member of Grupo Solidario Renacer. He is married and has three children whom he lives with in the community of San Esteban, Olancho. His wife makes a living attending to the grocery store and fulfilling the household chores. Juan has made a living for the past five years in the buying and selling of milk. He also has a small grocery store where his wife helps when he is not there. She is a person that supports him in everything that he has decided to undertake. 

He leaves to sell milk from his car at 6:00 am until 12:00 pm and spends his afternoon taking care of the grocery store. On occasion, difficulties have presented themselves, being that in the summer it is more complicated because there is less production and as such his earnings are reduced. 

With the help of this loan he will be able to purchase products such as rice, sugar, beans, butter, soap, detergent, refreshments and sweets, among others because he needs to stock the grocery store to offer his customers all that they need. One of his challenges is offering his community better service giving them lower prices and better attention. His goal is to come to have a small market where his customer can find all that they need. 

Juan has been a client of FAMA for more than 10 years and has been punctual with his payments.

loans.use: to buy general groceries.

loans.name: La Unidad Iv Group

texts.es:
La señora Trancita esta casada, tiene 39m años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad d estudiar, se dedica al comercio a la venta de camas de diferente marcas, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus padres, y hasta el momento lleva 12 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para capital de trabajo y hacer la inversión en la compra de camas para su posterior venta, y obtener ganancias. En el futuro tener vehículo propio para la venta de camas. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la venta de camas, venta de medicinas, venta de carneros y atención a tienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Trancita is 39 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She makes a living selling different brands of beds. Thanks to the support of her parents she started this business and currently has 12 years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who also works in the same business.

She has organized a group to ask for a loan that she will use as working capital and invest it by purchasing beds that will later be sold for profit. In the future, she would like to have a vehicle of her own that she can use for selling beds. The other group members make a living selling beds, medicines, sheep, and running a store that sells everyday goods.

loans.use: to purchase beds for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to make the arepas and to have maintenance performed on the electric mill.

loans.name: Lavura

texts.en: Lavura is 52. She lives with her son, Mkrtich. For 15 years, Lavura and her son have been running an orchard where they grow grape trees. Lavura needs sufficient funds to start and organize cultivation of the trees. She wants to purchase fertilizer, as well as administer a special injection into the trees to protect them from diseases. Lavura will also pay for the cultivation of the land which is essential to ensure a good and rich harvest. This is important for Lavura, as she will earn more income from the sale of grapes and create better conditions for her household.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, injections for the grape trees, and land cultivation

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 34 years old. He is a hardworking man who has one child and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  His personal goals include educating his child and buying a car.

He has been into motorcycle transport for the last five years.The sector is very profitable since the operational costs are very low.He faces hardships of high fuel costs, high taxes and customers who do not pay on time. However, he has a vision of buying three more motorcycles and give them to hired riders who will remit 80% of the daily earnings to him. Richard intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a conservative woman. She is unwilling to upload her photo on internet, so the photo is of her husband. Kholoud is a 36 year old married woman who lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is a mother of 5 children.

Kholoud is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so that she can improve her home living conditions and do maintenance for it to be a healthy place to live.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food supplies

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 48 year old married woman. She lives in Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Majeda is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so that she can improve her home living conditions. She want to do maintenance on her home and buy some missing furniture.

loans.use: to improve her home living conditions.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 46 year old married woman. She lives in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is a mother of 2 children.

Najah is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so that she can buy raw materials to make embroidery. This will allow her social and financial level to be improved.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 38 years old and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He is married and has two children.

He has been operating a phone business and a salon for five years.  The main challenges he faces in his business include price fluctuation, inconsistent supply of power and inadequate capital.  Jimmy is requesting a loan to buy power inverters and batteries for use in his two business when electricity is off .  In the future, he aspires to move his salon business to a more permanent location and buy land to grow crops.

In addition, he aims to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to buy power inverters and batteries for use in his two businesses.

loans.name: Cuchumatanes Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Ricarda esta casad, cursó los 3años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la compra y venta de carneros, inicio este negocio vendiendo gallinas en casa de los vecinos y hasta el momento lleva 12 años en la compra y venta de animales.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo para incrementar su venta de carneros, para su posterior venta y tener ganancias, ya que en el futuro espera mejorar su capital de trabajo y tener varios puntos de venta en su localidad. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la venta de carneros, gallinas, pollos, pavos, cerdos, verduras, pan, venta de tamales, venta de medicinas.
texts.en:
Margarita Ricarda is married, studied for three years in primary school, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She runs a business buying and selling lambs. She began this business by selling chickens to her neighbors out of her house, and since that time has had twelve years of experience buying and selling animals. 

She organizes a group and is asking for a loan to increase her sales of lambs and to make a profit. In the future, she hopes to improve her working capital and have multiple sales locations in her area. The other members work selling lambs, hens, chickens, turkeys, pigs, vegetables, bread, tamales, and medicines.

loans.use: to buy lambs

loans.name: Carlos Danilo

texts.es: Carlos Danilo tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida, ellos residen en la Comunidad del Coyolar, San Esteban. El negocio lo comenzó desde hace 10 años con una pequeña venta de arena y piedra, luego fue extendiendo su negocio y ahora también vende bloque, el trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos y su esposa que le ayudan con el sostenimiento del negocio, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm, una de las ventajas es que no paga personal ya que trabaja con sus hijos y su esposa. El préstamo que Carlos Danilo solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de material como ser: cemento y arena para la elaboración de bloques. Con la ayuda de este préstamo  en su negocio podrá ofrecer más producto a sus clientes ya que tendrá suficiente capital para trabajar e invertirlo en la compra de materiales para producir el bloque y así poder ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad de producto. El único desafío que enfrenta es porque tiene competencia ya que varias personas se dedican a lo mismo, pero Carlos ofrece a sus clientes producto de calidad y un servicio eficiente. Su meta es extender su negocio y dar a conocer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes. Carlos Danilo ha sido cliente de FAMA por más de 10 ciclos y ha logrado cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Carlos Danilo is 42 years old; he is married and has five children.  His wife sells food for a living.  They live in the community of Coyolar, San Esteban.  He started his business ten years ago with a small sale of sand and stone; he then extended his business and he now also sells cement blocks.  He works along with his children and his wife, who help him to keep up his business.  His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.  One advantage he has is that he does not have to pay for staff as he works with his children and his wife.  Carlos Danilo needs this loan to invest in materials, such as cement and sand to make cement blocks, so he can offer his customers a variety of products.  The only challenge he faces is competition because there are various other people who do the same thing, but Carlos offers his customers a quality product and efficient service.  His goal is to expand his business and introduce new products for his customers.  Carlos Danila has been a client of FAMA's for over ten loan cycles and he has been able to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand

loans.name: Anisa

texts.en: Anisa is a 45-year-old married woman who has seven children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen.  To be able to generate the earnings that she needs, she decided to make incense at home to sell as a street vendor. She currently spends about five hours each day walking around under the intense sun in the city in order to sell incense. She is able to make a profit. She is always thinking about being able to increase her customers, and for a long time, has been offering them friendly service so that they will buy from her again. She has requested a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to expand her business by buying perfumes and tools for incense, which will increase her profit. In the future, she hopes to have a cosmetic shop in addition to this business.

loans.use: To buy incense tools and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Grupo Comunal Group

texts.es:
La señora Rodriga esta casada tiene 25 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la venta de carneros y verduras en la plaza de su localidad, inicio su negocio de comercio vendiendo verduras y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuanta con apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de carneros y verduras y de esa forma incrementar sus ventas. Espera en el futuro expandir el negocio y con mas puntos de venta. Las demás integrantes de grupo se dedican a la venta de carneros, venta de verduras, ventas de frutas, venta de artículos de consumo diario y al cultivo de papas.
texts.en:
Rodriga is married and 25 years old. She has completed three years of primary education. She makes a living selling sheep and vegetables in the local plaza. She started her business selling vegetables and as of now has eight years of experience. She receives support from her husband who works in agriculture. 

She organizes a group and is asking for a loan which she will use for the purchase of sheep and vegetables which in turn will increase her sales. In the future she hopes to expand the business itself and to have more sales locations. The other members of the group are engaged in the sale of sheep, vegetables, fruit, daily consumer goods, and the cultivation of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sheep and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es: La señora  Flor maría  es propietaria de una pulpería estable, ubicada en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, tiene aproximadamente veinte años de tener su negocio, ofreciendo así una gran variedad de productos tales como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, variedades de jabón, cosméticos, carnes, entre otras muchas cosas, actualmente está sirviendo como una mini distribuidora de granos básicos, abasteciendo a mini-pulperías ubicados en esta zona, el  crédito con ceprodel lo esta solicitando  para comprar arroz faisán. agradece mucho el apoyo que esta institución le pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Flor María is owner of a small grocery store, located in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. She has been running her business for around 20 years and offers a great variety of products like rice, sugar, beans, oil, various soaps and cosmetics, meats and many other things. 

She is currently acting as a mini distributor of basic grains supplying mini-grocery stores in the area. The loan she is asking for through Ceprodel is intended for purchasing El Faisán branded rice.

She is thankful for the support this institution is able to offer.

loans.use: to buy El Faisan brand rice.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, residen en la comunidad de Agua Blanca, San Esteban, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora. Antonio comenzó a trabajar con la ganadería desde muy temprana edad, inicio con dos vacas y con la poca ganancia que le quedaba siguió comprando con lo que ahora tiene buenas crías de ganado y una bonita propiedad, sigue con el negocio de la ganadería y trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos y con varios empleados. El único desafío es en el verano  que la sequia afectara mucho el pasto con el que alimenta a su ganado. El préstamo que Antonio solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de ganado y cerdos. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá mejorar su hacienda y tendrá mejores ingresos que le ayuden con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es tener un negocio estable y muy productivo. Es su primer financiamiento en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Antonio is 44 years old, is married and has three children. They reside in the community of Agua Blanca, San Esteban. Antonio's wife is dedicated to doing the housework. The family is very united and hard-working. Antonio started to work with cattle farming at a young age. He started with two cows and with the small profit that he earned, he continued buying more cows. Now he has good livestock and a pretty property. He continues with his business of cattle farming and works with his children and various employees. The only challenge is the summer, during which the drought will affect the grass with which he feeds his cattle. 

Antonio needs the loan he is requesting in order to invest in the purchase of cattle and pigs. With the help of this loan he will be able to improve his ranch and he will have increased income that will help him to support his family. His goal is to have a stable and very productive business. This is his first loan at FAMA and he expects to pay his loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Maricela America

texts.es: Desde Playas les presentamos a Maricela. Tiene 38 años de edad y está casada con Benito quien trabaja de obrero en una procesadora de atún y derivados. Tienen 3 hijos, 2 varones y una niña quienes asisten al colegio y escuela fiscal. Maricela nos cuenta que comenzó como ayudante de una picantería donde ganaba $ 8 dólares diarios pero su jornada era solo en la mañana. Eso le convenía ya que podía cuidar de sus hijos que estaba pequeños y no tenia con quien dejarlos. Por la tarde salía a la esquina de su domicilio con un asador pequeño y vendía alitas de pollo, chuzos y choclo recaudando alrededor de $ 30 dólares diarios. Poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y ahora tiene un local donde vende meriendas al personal que sale de la compañia y ya no trabaja en la picantería. Maricela nos comenta que abre solo de lunes a viernes porque el fin de semana sin trabajadores no vende mucho. En la actualidad tiene un ayudante el cual trabaja con ella desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche que es cuando más vende. Este es el 4 crédito que solicita Maricela y para D-Miro es un orgullo y ejemplo de superación ya que damos fe de su superación porque juntos hemos visto su avance. Desde que inicio con un simple puesto de venta fuera de casa hasta el local que en estos momentos tiene. Nos solicita otro crédito para adecuar el negocio y tener dinero para el negocio. Maricela suerte y cumple todas tus metas propuestas estamos para apoyarte.
texts.en: From Playas, we present Maricela. She is 38 years old and married to Benito, who is a worker at a company which processes tuna and tuna products. They have 3 children, 2 boys and a girl, who attend secondary school and business school. Maricela tells us that she started as a helper in a restaurant where she earned 8 dollars a day, but her hours were only in the morning. This was convenient for her since she could care for her children, since they were young and she had nobody she could leave them with. In the afternoon she would go to the corner of her house with a small roaster and sold chicken wings, skewers, and ears of corn, collecting about 30 dollars a day. Little by little her business has been growing. Now she has a restaurant where she sells snacks to the employees leaving the company. She no longer works in the other restaurant. Maricela tells us that she opens only from Monday to Friday because she doesn't sell much on the weekend without workers. Currently she has a helper who works with her from 4 in the afternoon until 10 at night, which is when she sells the most. This is Maricela's 4th loan and for D-Miro it is a proud example of success. We have faith in her success because together we have seen her advance, from the beginning with a simple stand outside of her house to the restaurant that we have now. She asks us for another loan to adapt the business and to have money for the business. D-Miro says: Maricela, good luck, and meet all of your proposed goals, we are here to support you.

loans.use: to buy chicken, skewers, and ears of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy phone minute refills for resale to the public.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Virginia esta casada, tiene 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de verduras, en las plazas de su localidad, inicio este negocio con un puesto de venta pequeño en la plaza y hasta el momento lleva 18 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo negocio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, consistente en verduras,guisquil, zanahorias, papas, cebollas, etc. Espera en el futuro expandir sus negocio en las demás plazas de la región. Las demás se dedica a la venta de carne, verduras, papas, y atención a tienda de consumo.
texts.en:
Virginia is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She makes a living selling vegetables in her town's plazas. She started this business with a small stall in the plaza and she now has 18 years of experience. She has the support of her husband who also works in the same business.

She has organized a group and is asking for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise consisting of vegetables such as: chayote (a type of squash), carrots, potatoes, onions, etc.

She hopes to expand her business in the future to the remaining plazas in her region. The other group members make a living selling meat, vegetables, potatoes, and running a general store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane wants a loan to buy fertilizers so as to rehabilitate her farm land.She is thirty-five years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She desires to have a stable income and educate her children.Inadequate capital and seasonal changes hinder her business and her dream is to venture into modernized farming.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizers so as to rehabilitate her farm land.

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: La  Alcancía Comunal “Hacienda Chacrasana” está conformado por 09 mujeres emprendedoras que tienen como único propósito seguir progresando cada día. Doris de 36 años es casada con 02 hijos menores de edad. Doris se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanía. Este trabajo comenzó gracias a su hermana, pues fue  ella quien la animo a trabajar en dicho negocio. Gracias a  su trabajo y dedicación Doris ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El deseo de Doris es de poner su propia tienda de artesanía, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de materiales como marmolina, pinturas, pinceles, y también para algunos medicamentos para su hijo, ya que se encuentra delicado de salud. La Alcancía Comunal “Hacienda Chacrasana” agradece el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Hacienda Chacrasana" is formed by nine enterprising women whose sole purpose is to continue progressing each day. Doris is 36 years old and married with two young children. Doris makes and sells crafts. This work started thanks to her sister, as it was she who encouraged her to work in that business. Thanks to her work and dedication, Doris has been able to help her husband with household expenses. Doris wants to operate her own craft store because that will ensure that she will have more profits. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy materials such as marble powder, paints, brushes, and also for some medication for her son, as he is in poor health. The communal bank "Hacienda Chacrasana" appreciates the loan provided.

loans.use: to buy marble powder, paints, brushes, and medication.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: Don José es casado, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas, su esposa se dedica al comercio y es ama de casa, el es una persona muy amable, servicial y alegre, y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Hace algunos años comenzó vendiendo golosinas y poco a poco logro establecer el negocio de la pulpería vendiendo productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, frijoles y otros productos de uso domestico, luego fue surtiendo su negocio con otros productos que los mismos clientes le recomendaban vender. El trabaja en conjunto con su esposa y en el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a manejar su negocio, su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 6:00 am y culmina a las 7:00 pm. Don José solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, sal, frijoles, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos que le ayuden con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es incrementar el negocio, que este bien surtido y que sus clientes puedan encontrar todo lo que necesiten. Don José tiene 5 ciclos de recibir el apoyo de FAMA mediante los préstamos obtenidos y ha mantenido un  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en: Don José is married, 46, and has two children. His wife is a merchant and a housewife. José is a very likeable, helpful and happy person. He has a small general store in his home. Several years ago he started selling candy, and bit by bit he was able to establish his business selling products such as: sugar, rice, butter, beans, and other home products.
